97001.name: Rebel Times (Issue 23 - Aug 2009)
97001.description: Yet another issue of Rebel Times

97002.name: Secret of the Ninja
97002.description:
From the back of the book.

Ominous things are happening at the dodjo of your good friend Nada-powerful thunderstorms in the middle of dry season objects that seem to move themselves, piercing sounds coming from empty rooms. Nada traces it all to the arrival of a samurai sword from an anonymous benefactor. The sword has highly unusual and distinct carvings on it's hilt. Nada feels the dojo is under attack and the sword has something to do with it. You use your years of aikido practice to meet the challenges you face in your quest to solve the mystery of the sword. But it may not be enough. You may have to learn the secret arts of the ninja to help Nada vanquish this sword threat once and for all. You too may need to move without sound, fire weapons without force and walk in the invisible realm of the kuji. Good luck!

97003.name: Dofus
97003.description:
Source: The Developer's website.

Treading a lush path between video game and animated cartoon, DOFUS brings a whole new dimension to online Massively Multiplayer Online Role-Playing Games.

With its manga-inspired graphics, gripping tactical game play and wild humour, DOFUS has created a unique style of its own for other MMORPGs to follow. Experienced players are seduced by its strategic turn-based fighting system, which is a rare feature in MMORPGs, while casual players are drawn to the game's accessibility.

And to top it all off, in spite of the dense diversity of the game world, DOFUS is no bigger than 150 Mbs in size - not many MMORPGs can boast such a lightweight download.

User Summary

You can create a character from one of 15 races, each with its own spells. You advance in level by fighting monsters in turn-based tactical battles and doing quests. You can also learn professions to create magic items and earn money by trading with other players. As you increase in power you can focus on different characteristics and learn new spells or improve existing ones. Each race thus has many different paths to develop along depending on the player's preference and together with a huge variety of equipment, pets and mounts this means no two players are the same.

You can fight in teams, link together with friends in guilds, and fight other players in an alignment based player vs player system. There is also a "Kolosseum" in which teams of 3, in theory of roughly equal strength, battle it out with each other.

97004.name: Mandate Archive: Red Sangha Mercenary Corps
97004.description:
Introduction:
The Red Sangha mercenary company is the legacy of a zealot’s blind fanaticism and the biochemical excesses of a fallen age. Condemned to short, neurochemically straitened lives of cold-blooded serenity, the Red Sangha endures its particular damnation as best it can. Its services in conflict resolution and personal defense are famed throughout the sector, and many petty kings and local tyrants seek their assistance in resolving untoward rebellions. Still others seek the lost arts that created the Red Sangha and the secrets that would forever cement their grasp on the brains of their wretched subjects.

97005.name: Beyond Escape!
97005.description:
From the back of the book.

The new nation of Turtalia is caught in a death struggle with the evil Doradan state. Warfare has spread to San Francisco, where a determined band of guerillas is holding out in the hills watching the destruction of this once beautiful city. With the stakes high-for freedom, democracy and the rule of law and not men-the struggle against the police state of Dorado is fierce. But the spectre of none of these freedoms is worse. Don't give up!

97006.name: Mandate Archive: Martial Arts
97006.description:
introduction:
The default presumption of Stars Without Number is that while a skilled unarmed combatant can be a dangerous foe, there¡ s no substitute for a gun. Unarmed combatants never need to worry about being disarmed and are perilous enemies even when stripped of their equipment, but most PCs will sensibly prefer to pick up a combat shotgun or shear rifle when they have the opportunity. Such rules model most flavors of science fiction and correspond to most players¡ intuitive expectations about how combat ought to play out. Guns are the weapons of choice, with primitive weaponry as backup and unarmed combat as a choice of last resort

Not every group prefers to go with this hierarchy. Some GMs and players prefer game worlds in which choosing to fight unarmed is a mechanically viable choice, and the expert unarmed combatant is no worse off than the expert rifleman. The following optional rules give a boost to unarmed combat so that the level 6 warrior with Combat/Unarmed-3 is every bit as lethal as his comrade who has specialized in projectile weaponry.

97007.name: Mandate Archive: Bannerjee Construction Solutions
97007.description:
from the introduction:
Space Stations on the Frontier
A frontier world is nothing without a space station of its own. It is a trifling outpost at best, a half-barbarous colony world that can service only atmosphere-capable tramp merchants and shuttlecraft. It can do nothing for the ungainly bulks of mobile asteroid smelters or naval warships. Some starfaring worlds are forced by circumstances or necessity to make do with a strictly planetary starport, but most worlds count it a point of pride that they should have a constant presence in the void above their world.

97008.name: The Brilliant Dr. Wogan
97008.description:
From the back of the book.

A machine that could stop radiation would shift the balance of world power overnight. In the right hands, it could herald a new age of world peace. In the wrong hands, it would spell disaster. The brilliant Dr. Wogan has designed such a machine. But she has gone missing, along with the plans. As her right hand assistant, everyone looks to you to help find her. "Wars are best before they begin." Or so said the great Chinese military strategist Tsun Tzu in the 6th century. Nuclear disarmament would sure help, you think. Dr. Wogan's device will make a better world. But it's not a world everyone necessarily wants. Good luck!

97009.name: Mandate Archive: The Dust
97009.description:
introduction:
The Terran Mandate was a sclerotic hulk in the final decades before the Scream. It was the frozen heart of an empire that had long since outgrown its rule, and the core worlds curled inward in a self-enforced stasis. Destabilizing elements were ejected from the core and spun outward into the wild black of the frontier to prosper or to perish. Earth was caught in an amber of its own devising, unchanging, unmoving, unthinking of anything save the Mandate's own perpetuation. It was not born in its coffin, however- it ended there through a combination of fear, ambition, and plans laid all too cleverly.

97010.name: Rebel Times (Issue 24 - Sep 2009)
97010.description: Yet another issue of Rebel Times

97011.name: Rebel Times (Issue 25 - Oct 2009)
97011.description: Yet another issue of Rebel Times

97012.name: Return to Atlantis
97012.description:
From the back of the book.

On your first solo journey to find the Lost Continent of Atlantis, you fail to bring back proof of your success. Now you and your colleague Horton James III are returning to document this amazing otherworld. But back below the surface of the sea dangers abound. A treacherous king lures you to riches, rebel slaves lure you to help lead a revolt; and the evil Nodoors aim to capture you and keep you below... for good. A greedy king, evil politicians, peace loving peoples- they are all residents in the underwater world of Atlantis. Do you want to stay below to help the Atlanteans? Or do you return to the surface with proof of the lost continents existence? Will you be taken prisoner before you even get to make that choice?

97014.name: Dungeon of Dread
97014.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Fantastic treasure lies deep within the Dungeon of Dread, but to find it you must survive a deadly gauntlet. Heroes band together to form adventuring parties and face off against monsters and villains in the dungeon—but the adventure doesn't end there!

Dungeon of Dread is an exciting, cooperative board game experience in which heroes unite in battle to achieve a common goal and defeat the enemies standing in their way. If they succeed, glory and fortune will be theirs for the taking. If they fail, all could be lost!

This cooperative board game experience is designed for 2-5 players, ages 10 and up. One player is the Dungeon Master who runs the villains and monsters; the remaining players are the heroes. The game includes four adventures, each one featuring a unique villain.

Update, August 11, 2011

Apparently Dungeon of Dread was not as "exciting" as Wizards of the Coast hoped for, as the company announced at Gen Con 2011 that the title was no longer scheduled for release.

97015.name: Inca Gold
97015.description:
From the back of the book.

After a long night of researching, your computer programs locates a straight line-this could be the first clue in locating the ancient Lost City of the Incas. An eccentric billionaire, a ruthless archaeologist, strange twin tricksters in the middle of the jungle, and Pizarro's mythic Lost City of Gold form a potent and treacherous mix. You will need all your skills and wits to outsmart the adventurers who want to get the lost Incan treasures before you. If you succeed in finding the secrets of the jungles of Peru, will you leave them there or take them with you?

97017.name: Tattoo of Death
97017.description:
From the back of the book.

You befriend two boys at your martial arts studio. Before you know it, you are initiated into the menacing Red Flower Gang. The only problem is you want no part of the under-cover smuggling operation that they are running. The Red Flowers are using your mom's beach house as their drop off point for illegal immigrants from China. You are hiding upstairs listening to their plan. These guys are training for big time crime. Do you succumb to their deadly deals, do you fight for the freedom of others? Make your choice before it's your last!

97018.name: Silver Wings
97018.description:
From the back of the book.

Taking a quick day trip to Baja in your motor glider turns from glamorous to dangerous when your friends glider makes an emergency landing. The area looks treacherous-and so does your situation!
You're going to encounter a bit more than some turbulence during this flight. Baja may be Beautiful, but crash landings are just the beginning of your troubles. Armed and dangerous people are lurking about, and you're certain not to make it home before nightfall!

97019.name: Island of Time
97019.description:
From the back of the book.

You have spent your whole life hiking and exploring an island in Lake Champlain, not far from your home. One weekend, you and your friend Jayme decide to make a trip out to the island. Her anxieties about the weather grow more realistic and you lose control of the Zodiac, your boat-leaving you stranded in the middle of the enormous lake! Your difficult trek to the island are only the beginning of your adventures. The storm has brought a lot of strange things with it- the moment you step ashore you and Jayme feel it. You don't know how, but you are certain the island has taken you back in time.

97020.name: Dark Journey
97020.description:
From the publisher:

Adventure Type: Dungeon Adventure
Level: 1-4
Party: 3-5 characters
Setting: Aihrde, Portable to Home-brew
Its a dungeon crawl in every sense of the word. There is little back story, allowing the CK to plunge into the dungeon almost immediately. Its filled with adventure, danger and glory.
Dark Journey is a dungeon adventure cast in the classic mold. Here the CK is able to present the players a network of inter-connecting halls, rooms, chambers, cellars and more. A wizard's old hold, it offers libraries guarded by strange monsters, laboratories, cellars, trapped chambers and more; here lies the wizard's forgotten wealth, his magic, his money, his artifacts. But the adventurer must be wary for wizard's do not idly set treasures down but that they are trapped or protected by guards and wards and monsters summoned from dark places.

97021.name: Smoke Jumpers
97021.description:
From the back of the book.

Weeks of training may leave you feeling prepared for the exciting first jump into the forest fires of the Pacific Northwest, but you can't be sure until you take your first leap from a plane! Jumping is just the beginning! Did your training ready you for solitary treks through the wilderness even the rangers never venture through? These fires are unpredictable- you might even suspect arsonists are afoot in these beautiful forests.

97022.name: Chinese Dragons
97022.description:
From the back of the book.

You know that this ancient clan shows no mercy to it's captors You've heard stories you now realize are true, of skulls lain end to end, or found in piles throughout the land. They number in the thousands and lie bleached by the sun and rain, a testament to the power of the Chinese Dragons. You've got to do something, you realize. But what? A fun for freedom could be risky. Perhaps it would be best to remain where you are and take your chances as a prisoner. There haven't been many options for you so far as a young orphan in 7th century China. But you are brave, wise and skilled. It is the dawn of the Tang Dynasty and powerful warriors are bringing change all around you. Who will you become now that you are free from the drudgeries of servitude on your Uncle's family farm?

97023.name: Track Star!
97023.description:
From the back of the book.

The game room is empty. It's as if no one had been there earlier. The glasses and plates are gone, the sports magazines are neatly arranged on the coffee table. The giant screen plasma TV is silent. It is spooky. What to do? you ask yourself. Search for them? Just wait and see if they come back? Scram out of there and forget the whole thing? That's when the screams begin-horrifying screams and loud angry shouts. As a powerful student athlete, every choice you make sets the course for your track career and your life. There are people who'd like to see you win, and people who'd do anything to keep you from it. And then there are people who believe that athletes should do anything to win- even if it means breaking the rules of the game.

97024.name: Blood on the Handle
97024.description:
From the back of the book.

You notice one of the built in bookcases against the back wall of your uncle's study sticks out apart from the others. It must be a secret passageway. You pry loose the bookcases away from the wall. Sure enough, there is a dusty, cobweb-lined passageway into the darkness. The footsteps are closer now; you have to do something. Rushing to the window, you look down. There is a six inch ledge and beyond that a twenty foot drop.
Life as an orphan has always been lonely, but your Uncle Morgan has been able to provide you with many wonderful luxuries- your own motorcycle, trips around the world, and life in a mansion. But you actually know nothing about Morgan, and his secrets make you suspicious. Could he be a spy, or a jewel thief? A brilliant novelist researching a murder mystery? Or has something terrible happened to your only family member left?

97025.name: Zombie Penpal
97025.description:
From the back of the book.

Zombies and their controlling bokors, the charms and protective
spells of voodoo, and the occult all mix in with every day life for
your penpal in New Orleans. Your life in sleepy Maine is much
different, and you love your penpal's spine-tingling tales. A new
girl shows up at your school who reminds you of your penpal. You
haven't received a letter since Hurricane Katrina. Is this your
penpal? She looks...changed. Watch out, because zombies want one
thing most of all-- to eat your brain!!

97026.name: Behind the Wheel
97026.description:
From the back of the book.

You've always dreamed of racing cars. Finally your chance has arrived! Your cousin has lent you his race car and you are ready to race a rally that runs through Germany, France, and Switzerland. Not everyone in the race plays fair- there are plenty of bribes, and even sabotage! Your car alone is not going to win. Be on your toes because the race is on!

97027.name: Metapontum Peace Chess
97027.description:
Metapontum is a cooperative abstract strategy game created and promoted by Dutch designer Hans Theo Frenkel and the foundation he created, for the purpose of promoting world peace. It is played on an 8x8 hexagonal board with 16 pieces on each side, that have movement very similar to those in Chess, and are abstract as in Chess. The goal of Metapontum is for both sides to exchange their pieces from their chosen opening setup to their chosen end setup in a minimum amount of moves. On every turn, a player can either move one of his pieces or exchange one of his pieces with one of his opponent's, as long as his piece has line of sight to the other.

Frenkel's web site sells various game boards made out of either cardboard, wood or stone. Frenkel claims that all games are produced under fair trade practices.

97028.name: Punishment: Earth
97028.description:
From the back of the book.

As tow of the youngest residents of the Planet Orca, you and your best friend Og are under the constant rule of the planet's elders. You haven't ever feared the wrath of the Supreme Orcan Senate, although you haven't ever strayed too far from the rules you've grown up knowing. When you stray into the off-limits Lost Region, you are surprised at what you find. a history of your planet you never knew about- even evidence of interplanetary warfare that must have occurred generations before your birth. On your planet, curiosity is forbidden and punished by exile- to an even more mysterious planet you know as Earth!

97029.name: What if... You Broke All the Rules
97029.description:
Summary from inside cover.

Armed with a new camcorder, Haley continues her sophomore year at Hillsdale High, as the reader's choices help her navigate a series of events that begin with a potentially disastrous New Year's eve party and end with what could be the spring break of her dreams.

97031.name: What if... Your Past Came Back to Haunt You
97031.description:
Summary from inside cover.

Everyone has a secret- and Haley's is about to be revealed. As the students of Hillsdale High return from Thanksgving break, the past is very much part of the present. Annie has started up a club to talk about the planet's environmental past- and how it might affect the future. Coco is celebrating her past sixteen years with a lavish birthday party. Whitney and Sasha are BFFs again. And Irene and Shaun toy with the idea of getting permanent reminders of where they came from. This fall, Haley's past is coming back to haunt her. Spoiler alert: Her secret will change the way the boys at school look at her from now on.

97032.name: What if... Everyone Knew Your Name
97032.description:
Summary from inside cover.

The readers choices control the course of Haley's sophomore year at the new high school as she navigates the social scene, deciding whether she wants to become a queen bee, a wannabee, a freak or a geek.

97033.name: Flying Saucer: Vessel of Abduction
97033.description:
From the Editorial Introduction

The Flying Saucer is the seventh in the series of V&V locations
presented as free PDF downloads by Dave Woodrum. It is also the second of those that are a bit longer and intended to provide a more complete package for the GM with which to run adventures – hence, it is the second to be termed a “play set.”

The Flying Saucer is in some ways a sequel to the Tabloid Office location in that it uses the information provided in that action location about the alien Greys. Herein the Greys are used in a solo play mini-adventure. Yes, this is the first time that a “freebie” includes a complete mini-adventure and we all hope that this addition is well-received by GMs and players.

As editor, it is nice to see another such product from Dave Woodrum, who had been ultra-busy with course work from job related classes over the past several months. Dave is also fully involved in the preparation of other projects for use with the Villains & Vigilantes game system and we can look forward to more of his creativity in the future.

Scott B. Bizar, Editor

97035.name: Knarly Hexes
97035.description:
Knarly Hexes is a new type of logic puzzle. The number in each cell indicates how many adjacent cells (up to 6) are the same color as that cell. When solved (correctly), each cell will be one of only two opposing colors. To aid in the solving of the puzzle, there are 10 different pairs of opposing colors, so you can work on unconnected areas of the puzzle. But eventually you have to decide how to merge areas with differing pairs of colors, until the entire puzzle is colored with only one color-pair. Each puzzle is guaranteed to have only one possible solution. Puzzles come in 8 sizes and 2 difficulty levels.

Source: The Game Website.

97036.name: Twilight Gothic Y2K Rulebook
97036.description:
From the Introduction:

Despite being a portrayal of the world today, the setting for Twilight Gothic does involve itself with the darker aspects of society. Because of the mature themes involved, reader discretion is advised.

Twilight Gothic is based upon the World of Darkness, used to describe the environment of Vampire - The Masquerade. For those of you who are new to the game, or have never before role-played, the World of Darkness is, quite simply the world in which you are now living. Human misery and suffering goes unnoticed by an uncaring community and those who are unfortunate enough to be born into poverty usually stay there. It is also a world run by the corporate machine. Vast intellectual businesses that control everything from your household telephone to television networks.

Yet there is another side to this bleak world... The supernatural. Far from being the stuff of fiction, the creatures of the supernatural involve themselves with our world in more ways that can be imagined. Werewolves run in packs through the forests, Wraiths and spirits haunt ruin and graveyard alike. While vampires live out their lives on the rain-washed streets of our cities.

The world of Twilight Gothic works on the fictional idea that vampires exist amongst us, lost in the faceless millions who inhabit the streets by night. Back stabbing and cruel, these creatures squabble and argue amongst themselves, whilst simultaneously trying to gather control of the mortals from which they feed.

Each player in Twilight Gothic builds a character for themselves - a vampire whose fate and fortunes they will play out. Once a character has been created the player is thrust into the Twilight Gothic World. The aim of the game? There is no aim. You are immersed in a world in which you are free to do as you wish; free to interact with other characters in whichever way you desire. But be warned - vampires are jealous creatures; as you build and enhance your character, others will plot your downfall. If you're lucky they will simply try to attack you. If you're unlucky, you'll never know they're there... until it's too late...

97037.name: Roads of Rome 2
97037.description:
Super sequel - Roads of Rome 2!!!
Take up new tricky tasks and overcome dangerous challenges in Roads of Rome 2, an addictive game that successfully combines strategy and time management features!

Caesar, the governor of Rome, has been poisoned, and there's no potion strong enough in the world of mortals that can cure him of his terrible disease. Caesar's daughter Julia is in despair and Victorius, an honorable general, sets out on a long journey to the kingdom of the Gods. The lands of barbarians are full of dangers, so be careful! Clear up your way and build roads, leave gifts and offerings on the Gods' altars and help Victorius find the magic potion that will save Caesar's life. Your quest will be long and difficult, but if you succeed, the Gods are sure to smile down on the citizens of Rome!

Shatter the peace and quiet of the Gods' kingdom and help Victorius accomplish lots of challenging tasks on his way. Glory to the brave warrior!

Source: The Publisher Website.

97038.name: Hammerfight

videogamehonor.32106: 2008 IGF Awards Excellence In Visual Art Nominee

97038.description:
Previously known as Hammerfall, Hammerfight is a Russian 2D physics-based video game. In the physics based gameplay, the player swings large melee weapons and rely on centripetal force to give the object enough kinetic energy to destroy enemies.

Source: Wikipedia, "Hammerfight", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

97039.name: The Book of Wird
97039.description:
(from the back of the book)

Open your mind to the infinite possibilities of Wird.

The Book of Wird, written by Steven S. Long is the ultimate guide to magic in Providence.

This massive tome includes fantastic spells for a wide range of Wird casters, including the familiar distinctions of Wird Weaver, Wird Dancer, Wylder and the vile Blight Crow, as well as the new Bright Orioles and Faithsingers.

In addition, the Book of Wird includes spells for many of Providence's professions, such as the Recognizers, the Slaywinds, and the D'Shau monks.

This encyclopedia of Wird also provides numerous secret spells for the Serpenkine. the Green People, the Swarm Dancers and the White Crow.

Finally, the Book of Wird provides magic items and detailed rules on their creation.

97040.name: Street FM
97040.description:
User summary:
A basic set of skirmish-level miniatures rules for urban combat between street gangs, law enforcement, special forces, etc. Game scale is 1:1 with each figure representing individual fighters, vehicles, etc. Each turn equals 5 seconds of "real" time and the ground scale is 1.5 centimeters equals 1 meter. These rules are intended for use with 28-30mm miniatures but could easily be adapted to smaller scales. Individual models are assigned individual skill levels (Streetwise, Brawling, Ranged Combat) and are given an allotment of Option Points to further customize each figure. Players equip each of their forces based on an Equipment Points system which allows them to add weapons, ammo, and miscellaneous equipment. Combat rules cover close combat, ranged, and special weapons such as RPGs and other heavy arms.

From the introduction:
'Street F.M.' is designed to represent small-scale conflict in a modern or near future urban environment. By employing scale models to represent the combatants and their surroundings it is possible to create clashes between street gangs, criminals, law enforcers and small military units. In fact any group entering urban combat, armed with everything from improvised weapons through to rocket launchers can be covered by the system.

97041.description:
Another DIY product for the GWAS series, adding the French and Russian Navies as prizes of the British and Germans. From the APL website...

"Different courses of the Great War might well have seen warships of the Marine Nationale or Imperial Russian Navy serving under British or German colors: taken as booty by a victorious Germany (the actual fate of Russia’s Black Sea Fleet), seized by Britain to prevent their falling into enemy hands following the defeat of an ally, sold in the face of more pressing priorities on land or a different ending to hostilities. Transferred to the North Sea arena across which the war’s two principal naval antagonists faced each other, the more modern of these ships could well have played critical roles in determining whether Britannia or Germania would ultimately hold Neptune’s Trident.

Prizes of War is a supplement for the Great War at Sea series that allows players to examine this question of alternate history. French and Russian ships from our Jutland and Mediterranean games are allocated to the Royal Navy and Kaiserliche Marine, and included in a series of 10 battle and 11 operational scenarios set in and around the North Sea.

Prizes of War includes 70 playing pieces (you will need to assemble these yourself) and this booklet. Playing all the scenarios in this supplement requires the included pieces plus maps and pieces from our Jutland game (and no others!).

Prizes of War is sold exclusively via .pdf download. The playing pieces are not die-cut and mounted, nor is the scenario book printed. Instead it comes as a series of .pdf files that will need to be assembled into the game’s components."
97041.name: Great War at Sea: Prizes of War

97042.name: A Tyme of Darkness
97042.description:
(from the introduction)

A TYME of DARKNESS is a module designed to give players a scenario for the popular WITCH HUNT game, but is also intended to clarify some of the Rule Systems. Included within this Module package is:

A) A TYME of DARKNESS: A free standing scenario which includes information for WITCH PLAYERS, MAGISTRATE PLAYERS and TOWN CRIER. Also, NPC stats and a VISIONS Section, & Disease Effects Chart.

B) TRAGEDY AT THE NORTH RIVER: a One-on-one Module.

C) Addenda and Clarifications: to WITCH HUNT boxed Game

D) Rumor Table: To be used in any WITCH HUNT Game

97043.name: Necropolis 2350: Adventure Compendium 1
97043.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Necropolis 2350 Adventure Compendium 1 contains a fantastic set of adventures for the sci-fi horror RPG Necropolis 2350 and is based in a fictional 24th century. In these dark days, mankind, divided into two main camps, stands on the brink of extinction. The Third Reformation Church are locked in desperate battle against "undead" invaders known as the Rephaim. While the heroes of humanity use advanced weapons and can call upon the power of faith, the twisted Rephaim are masters of necromancy and wield vile technology created from living tissue.

The Long Sleep

Deep in the Desert Something is stirring! An overdue routine communication from an archaeological team operating deep in the Ruber Desert requires investigation, and the Knights are given the task. What might have been a technical fault caused by recent solar storm activity turns out to be something far worse.

Snatch and Grab

In this adventure the Knights are ordered to secure unusual Rephaim specimens for scientific study. Alone in a hostile city, the Knights need to act quickly and quietly.

A Cardinal Error

Cardinal Vespasian, head of the Office of Agriculture, has been kidnapped by separatists seeking to join the Union of Corporations. To ensure a safe rescue, and make other kidnappers think twice about daring to use force against the Church and its officials, the Pope has personally ordered the Sacri Ordines to conduct a televised rescue mission. The orders for this quick adventure are brutally simple - rescue the prisoners, kill the kidnappers.

Three Short Adventures

When someone higher up the chain of command makes a mistake, it’s left to the Knights to appear live on the Church’s home-shopping channel to sell merchandize! Aiding another Preceptory, the Knights are assigned to walk the beat and police the streets. Have they got what it takes to deal with the public without resorting to violence? In the third adventure, a rescue mission leads to a terrifying discovery.

The Last Word

The Ordo is launching a recruitment drive at the Shrine of St. Malachy, a famous visionary from Earth’s history, and the Knights are ordered to win over hearts and minds. In addition to the recruitment operation, the Knights must also liaise regarding security of the shrine with its permanent guardians, the militant nuns of the Sisters of Bradamante. What should be a quiet mission quickly breaks down into violence and mayhem. The theft of a precious relic by a force more powerful than anything the Knights have faced before leads them on a desperate mission.

The Broken Seal

Dark times call for dark measures! When the Preceptor Master summons you to his office in the middle of the night and swears you to secrecy before giving the mission briefing, you know this isn’t going to be a routine operation. A secret order of monks, long forgotten by the leaders of the Third Reformation Church, keeps eternal watch over a powerful force, a creature of absolute evil. After centuries of dormancy the evil has awakened, for a prophesized time has finally come.

Additional Material

WM Appendix: Contains a quick system for creating non-combat missions, and additional Mission Tables to give the WM more choice in the sorts of combat adventures he runs.

Bestiary Update: Every stat you need to run the adventures is included to reduce book-flipping during play! Includes two new forms of Rephaim and two variants on the zombie stat block - sniper and grenadier.

97044.name: Dark Harvest: The Legacy of Frankenstein
97044.description:
Publisher Blurb:

What if Frankenstein got it right?

What if Victor Frankenstein had embraced his discoveries rather than seeking to destroy them?

Rejected by his peers and his family, hunted by the Creature, Victor slips into the background of history. Manipulating people, events, whole countries, Frankenstein slowly plans and executes his revenge.

Carved out of the Balkan conflicts of the mid-1800’s, Victor Frankenstein hijacks the unification of Romania and creates his own country: Promethea. Established on high ideals of equality and scientific advancement for the good of all, the reality is very different.

Creating Promethea saw Victor make deals that compromised the integrity of his vision. Almost literally walled off from the rest of Europe, Promethea is a nightmare where the rich elite feed off the beauty and strength of the poor. While incredible advances across all scientific disciplines promise a bright future, the land is blighted by a new feudal regime - the Harvest.

Even as Frankenstein moves to bring Promethea in line with his original vision, so he is stalked by the Creature. Seeking to destroy all his creator’s works, the Creature and the resistance movement he leads often find they share Frankenstein’s goals. Both Victor and the Creature know that Frankenstein’s gift must never escape the fortified borders of Promethea, bringing the dark harvest to all the world.

Dark Harvest: Legacy of Frankenstein is a detailed, fascinating game setting, a terrifyingly plausible alternative history and a fiction anthology; a gothic horror fantasy that will appeal to gamers and the general public alike.

A standalone product, Dark Harvest: Legacy of Frankenstein uses a version of the Heresy Engine system and is fully compatible with the Victoriana 2nd Edition, also available from Cubicle 7 Entertainment.

97045.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Khaine is the daughter of the legendary knight Rubedo D'elacreu of the sacred Order of Mikael. As with all her family, she is one of the beloved chosen of Azrael, the Lady of the Swords.

Warrior - Empire - Level 50

Divine Intervention (Magic, Reactive) - You can re-roll a die of any friendly unit-inside Khaine's Control Zone.

Sacred Attack (Ki, Attack) - Special Attack, +3 Attack / +2 Damage. Dark units suffer double damage from this attack.

Martyr Scrifice (Magic, Reactive) You can redirect the damage from a friendly unit inside your Contorl Zone to Khaine instead.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.
97045.name: Anima Tactics: Khaine D'Lacreu

97046.description:
Publisher Blurb:

One of the special agents of The Hand of the Emperor, Ducan is a warrior of great skill. After years of irreproachable services for Abel, he is now in charge of finding relics of the Lost Loggia.

Warrior - Empire - Level 45

Crossblade (Ki, Attack) - Special Impact. Duncan Carries out a normal attack; if the atack is successful, Duncan is able to make a second free attack.

Pride (Ki, Effect, Reactive) - Duncan gains Lv. 2 Protection.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.
97046.name: Anima Tactics: Duncan Reid

97047.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Regardless of her young age, Aoi is a formidable sorcerer, well versed in light magic. She loves human beings and desires to be able to live between them without the need to hide her true self. She works for Samael under the Fallen Angel Dinah, striving not only to accomplish her dream, but also to stop the dark schemes of radical Fallen Angels like Ophiel.

Mystic - Samael - Level 40

Spirtual Beam (Magic, Ranged Attack) - Distance (16 inch), +1 Attack / +3 Damage.

Moon Seal (Magic, Effect) - Discard two negative States counters of your choice affecting a single friendly unit inside Aoi's Control Zone.

Coral Ecstasy (Magic, Effect) - A friendly unit inside Aoi's Control Zone gains Lv1 Shield, Lv1 Healing, Lv1 Protection and Lev1 Haste. Aoi may not use Coral Ecstasy on herself.

Winds of Life (Magic, Effect) - Heals 2 Life poins of all friendly units inside Aoi's Control Zone.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.
97047.name: Anima Tactics: Aoi Inukai

97048.name: Ultimate Monsters
97048.description:
From the Back Cover

The world is a dangerous place, filled with all manner of perils from villains and evil-doers to the local terrain; all seem intent on putting an end to the lives of those who would dare stand against them. So in the face of such perils one would ask what could be worse, what terror could summon such feelings of dread as to incapacitate its prey? The answer is simple; the unknown.

When the hunters become the hunted there is little to fall back on and even the trusty sword can only provide so much protection. Now you will have knowledge; knowledge that even the most hardened of warriors would be unwise to scoff at.

Bringing together a collection of vile and horrifying creatures with which to populate the dark places of your fantasy worlds and reside your character's nightmares, Ultimate Monsters has been developed to aid both players and Games Masters alike as they venture into a wider and more dangerous world.

97049.name: The Power
97049.description:
(from the back of the book)

It Begins In Your Dreams...

The voice calling you, the summons echoing inside your skull. Your dreams are haunted by a being not of this world - your Mentor. Its eyes burn into your mind. The awesome Contact scours the depths of your soul, giving you Power beyond all imagination. The Power to know people's thoughts. The Power to engulf the air with flames. The Power to break people's wills. The Power to walk through others' dreams.

You wake...but the Dream remains and the chase begins. You and your Power are not alone...

Bring psychic Personae to life in a world fraught with danger - where cannibalistic Hunters stalk the night, eager to consume your Power; where Government agents are in constant pursuit to add you to their shadowy projects; where Corporate empires vie for your Power to lighten their grip on the public; where the chase can lead into your dreams and even beyond...

This book describes everything Players and Directors need to know about The Power, including detailed rules systems, roleplaying hints and in-depth setting information. Included are eleven full-color plates, two 20-page comic books, easy to reference charts to speed up play and an introductory Script to jump-start Players into the psychic world.

97050.name: PostHumous Z
97050.description:
There has been a zombie outbreak! The cameras focus in a small town, where a band of cliché characters has holed up, waiting for rescue. It never comes. Worse still, the zombies continue to grow in number and intelligence. A conclusion is drawn: If the characters wish to survive, they must make a break for the outskirts and escape the town. Will anyone be left when the credits roll?

PostHumousZ is a team based zombie survival horror game. Each player controls a single human character or horde of themed zombies. A modular town is randomly laid out each game, with the safe house at one end and the escape on the other. Likewise, every character and zombie theme is randomly generated by combining 3 cards giving each player, and team, its own strengths and weaknesses.

The humans must move through the town to the escape, collecting items, rescuing nameless survivors (extras), fighting zombies, and hiding at strategic moments. Zombies killed by the characters are taken as points, and are spent to activate abilities and buy powerful plot changing cards (H-cards). The zombies in turn spawn and direct the undead, collect hunger (zombies’ resource) and use their cards and abilities to overwhelm the humans before they escape. Unlike the humans, the zombies’ plot cards (Z-cards) are drawn freely over time as well as purchased, meaning the clock is against the living. Gameplay is dynamic as both teams are affected by random events and changes in their opponents’ strategy.

PostHumousZ 295 unique cards add near endless variation, depth, drama and humor to each game, while simple base rules and bold art make it quick to learn, easy to keep track of, and low on downtime.

97051.name: Casino
97051.description:
User Summary:

The game displayed in a top-down fashion. The players used their game paddles to manipulate the action on the TV screen. Players could choose any of the four games to play: Blackjack Ver.1, Blackjack Ver.2, Stud Poker, Poker Solitaire. The game allows up to four people to play.

97052.name: Word Zapper
97052.description:
User Summary

This is an educational game that helps children learn to spell. The player controls a spaceship that either zaps or grabs letters that scroll across the top of the screen. The objective is to spell out the word that was briefly shown to the player. There are also aliens that advance from the sides of the screen, and the player must shoot them with lasers from the spaceship. This game was played with the joystick controllers and allowed for either one or two players.

97053.name: Teach Key Math
97053.description: A 3M EduPLAYtional game. A "schoolhouse" holds cards that show basic math problems. Insert the key (a peg) into the hole with the correct answer and the card will slide free. Pick the wrong answer and the card is held in place. A very simple educational game, the math version of Teach Key Reading and Spelling.

97054.name: Adventures Dark and Deep: Bestiary (Playtest PDFs)
97054.description:
from the book:
Being a collection of creatures mundane and wondrous suitable to play the game.

This book contains a variety of different creatures, people, and beings with whom the players in the game can have their characters interact. Such interactions are the spice of the game, bringing it from the mundane realm into the fantastic.

97055.name: Barbie Just Us Girls
97055.description:
With a spin of the wheel, you must tell your secrets or take the challenge! Game makes childern act out or dance various Barbie scenerios, such as "Reciting a favorite Poem", Doing a 1 Minute Aerobic Routine, Changing Barbie's clothes in 30 Seconds or trying to do different dance routines. Try to Collect Cards w/Barbie Fashions, Cars & Other Accessories to Win! Sounds easy, right? However, a spink of the Barbie Wheel tells you if first you must tell a secret or perform a Barbie Challenge, such as Accepting an Award lik Superstar Barbie.

Components:

random spinning wheel,
25 What To Wear cards,
25 Going In Style cards,
25 Places to Go cards,
5 Ken cards,

97057.name: Mystery Maze
97057.description: The Inscrutable Game of Skill and Luck. The object of the game is to guide all the marbles, one at a time, into the hole in the game center, and score the most points in each round

97058.name: Destiny of the Metal Gods
97058.description:
Destiny of the Metal Gods is a role-playing about fighting robots in world based on Norse myth. It uses innovative cinematic rules that compel characters to put what's important to them on the line.

(Publisher blurb)

97059.name: Battaglia Aeronavale
97059.description: Typical game of Battleship that adds 3 planes, which have no particular special skills. Each player places two grids side by side. In the first grid, hidden by a screenplay depicting the world, he has to place his units, while in the second one he will place some chips showing the coordinates of the shots fired. The player who first hits all the enemy units wins.

97060.name: Superflash
97060.description: This game is based on a tv quiz show broadcast in Italy. A player will play the presenter, while the others the competitors. The game develops in 3 contests: the Curtain, where players in turn try to guess the character hidden by 16 tiles removing as few ones as possible, the Poll, where players try to guess the exact percentage of a national poll and the Big Quiz, where players try to answer a question on a exclusive selected subject between news, culture, science, show business, sport and advertising. Finally, each player has to answer to a question choosing between three different categories, namely music, history or literature/sport/show business, in order to double his own score or lose all the points scored. The player with the highest score, wins.

97061.name: Un Milione al Secondo
97061.description: This game is based on a tv quiz show broadcast in Italy. A player will play the presenter, while the others the competitors trying to answer questions on movie, music and sport subjects. The game develops in 2 phases. In the first phase, players collect points according to the difficulty of the trial by answering the questions or guessing the caricature of famous characters; in the second one, each player will have to answer to a number of questions on a subject chosen between movie, music and sport equal to the collected score divided by 3; for each correct answer, the player earns 3 millions £. The player who scores higher wins.

97062.name: The Ultimate Doom
97062.description:
The complete megahit game that set the world afire. Plus All-New Episode IV: Thy Flesh Consumed

The demons came and the marines died. Except one. Your are the last defense against these hell-spawned hordes. Prepare for the most intense mutant-laden, blood-splattered action ever! The texture-mapped virtual world is so real, you don't just play DOOM - you live it.

The Ultimate DOOM takes you beyond anything you've ever experienced. First, you get all three original episodes - that's 27 levels of awesome, explosive excitement. Then it really blows you away with an all-new episode: Thy Flesh Consumed.

Now you're dead meat. Just when you think you're getting pretty good at DOOM, you get hit with Perfect Hatred, Sever the Wicked and seven other expert levels never seen before! They're so incredibly tough, the first 27 levels will seem like a walk in the park!

Source: The Publisher Website.

97063.name: Bug Out
97063.description:
The Speedy Scramble for Slugs and Bugs!

Bug Cards are scattered all over your table or even your living room floor! Players race to capture the bugs by covering each Bug Card with a matching Leaf Card--It's a wild scramble to find each bug! Be the first player to cover all of your matching Bug Cards and Bug Out!

97064.name: Sealed with a Kiss
97064.description: Sealed with a Kiss is a game where girls collect kisses (yes, kisses!) on their boyfriend's photos. It works like this: Every player gets one of 12 boyfriend photos (these guys are hunks!). Anyway, put the photos in the frames and move around the game board collecting kisses. When you win a kiss, you use the special 'kisser' stamper to stamp your boyfriend's photo. But hey, life's not always great, is it? Sometimes you can lose kisses, take kisses, or even have to trade boyfriends. The first player to collect five kisses wins the game. It’s that easy and tons of fun!

97065.name: Transport: A Fascinating Card Game
97065.description:
60 cards, featuring Goods Cards, Conveyance Cards and Obstruction Cards.
It is a trick-taking game really, but quite advanced for its age. The first player in any round must offer a Goods Card. The next player may offer a Conveyance Card, suitable for carrying the Goods on offer. If he does, he collects the Goods Card. The third player may play an Obstruction to this arrangement and snaffle the Goods himself.
The winner is the player who collects the highest tonnage of Goods.

97068.name: Shadow Realms Live Action Roleplaying Game: Player's Manual
97068.description:
From the Introduction:

Shadow Realms is a game of epic fantasy. You help bring to life this story. As a Player Character you create a living personality within this world. The role you play is your choice. But remember; the actions you choose will shape your future.

Shadow Realms has an Honour Based System. This means that a Game Judge (known as Plot Marshals) will not be required to approve all character actions. Since a Plot Marshal cannot always be present, each player will have a Shadow Realms Character Sheet. This sheet will list all the skills available to the player. Players should be especially familiar with all the skills that pertain to their character.

All players are expected to follow the rules to the best of their abilities. Any form of intentional cheating is unacceptable and can result in Experience Point Reduction or Expulsion from the game.

Have fun! LARPing is a way to not just tell a tale or read a fantastic novel or even immerse you in video game. LARPing is a way to live that tale.

97069.name: Sister Steel
97069.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sister Steel: Pauline Rawlins is another one of Motherboard's rescued misfits. Her body is integrated with a shiny metallic sheath that keeps her alive and makes her literally a fighting machine. Sister Steel is a member of the Cybertribe.

97070.name: Heavy Metal
97070.description:
From publisher blurb:

Heavy Metal: Saved by Motherboard and kept alive only by the life-support systems in his huge exoframe, Jeffrey Rollins is a gentle giant. He really doesn't want to hurt anyone, but you'd best not threaten his sister, Sister Steel, or the other members of his new family, the Cybertribe.

97071.name: Peyo's Hunt
97071.description:
From the PDF

This adventure, designed for 4-6 characters of 3rd-5th level, is a light-hearted adventure that is designed to be
fun!

Every year the Sorcerer Balthazar sponsors a hunt for exotic creatures in the Dark Wood. This year’s hunt is for an elusive creature known as a Schlümpfe. Because the official hunting permits are so expensive, Balthazar held auditions to select the best hunting parties to sponsor. The parties present are those who have passed his audition and present the best chances bagging a full quota of Schlümpfe.

97072.name: Dark Anniversary
97072.description:
From the PDF

This adventure, designed for 4-6 characters of 5th through 7th level, is the first (of three) created for the 2009 Tournament of
Champions.

Parties of adventurers are discreetly hired by a trading company to investigate rumors that children all across the realm are being kidnapped for a nefarious purpose. While investigating the matter, the adventurers discover that troupes of children are being recruited in the cities and led out to an unknown location. Heading off into the wilderness, the parties find an ancient holy site that is swarming with children. Sneaking into the site, the adventurers discover that the throngs of ardent worshipers are being misled for
some evil reason and they set out to foil the Drow who seem to be behind the effort. Racing into the heart of the complex, the
adventurers undercover a double-cross and must quickly react to save the lives of the worshipers and multitudes of innocents across the region.

In this adventure, the party is being recruited to try and track down who has been kidnapping the cities’ children. Following their only lead, the party breaks into the local Thieves Guild. After working their way into the sewers, the party finds one party of children, but is too late.

97073.name: Primeval Core Rulebook

rpghonor.22011: 2013 Origins Awards Best Roleplaying Game Nominee

97073.description:
publisher blurb

Anomalies are starting to appear, doorways in time to worlds we can barely imagine. The anomalies are conclusive proof that the past exists in a fourth dimension as real and solid as those we already know. Our job is to predict and contain them.

The past, present and future of Earth are colliding as mysterious anomalies open up everywhere. You are part of an elite team of specialists. Your mission : keep prehistoric monsters in check, preserve the timeline, and uncover the secrets behind the Anomalies. You must protect the modern world from savage dinosaurs, primeval monsters and the horrors of the far future, but not everyone's on your side. Who can you trust?

Based on the hit TV show, Primeval lets you play as Nick Cutter, Connor, Abby and the rest of the Anomaly Research Centre team, or create your own groups of dinosaur hunters and time travellers. A billion years of danger and adventure awaits on the other side of the Anomalies!

This roleplaying game contains full rules for creating your own teams of investigators, battling dinosaurs, and making your own exciting stories. All you need is your imagination, a pair of six-sided dice, and your friends!

97074.name: Stress and Trauma:  Mental Health Rules for GORE
97074.description:
from the introduction:

Mental Health Rules

One thing missing from GORE is a set of rules for mental health. This void is significant, as it is a major component of one of the classic games GORE seeks to emulate. If player characters aren't struggling to keep from succumbing to madness, or dealing with non- player characters who have obviously gone 'round the bend, the flavor of the game just isn't the same. Unfortunately, the original rules for such are not available under the Open Gaming License, which explains their absence from the GORE Core Rules.

What is presented here is not an attempt to recreate the classic mental health rules, but an all-new, original set of mechanics for covering the same ground. In addition to filling a gap in GORE's Core Rules, it can be used as an alternative system for the classic game, or for any percentile-based game using the same algorithm.

user comment:
This supplement is available as a free download from basicroleplaying.com.

97075.name: Charge It!
97075.description:
The Crazy Credit Card Game!
Charge It! plays like real life. Big spenders bargain hunters and cash savers all have fun shopping and spending rolling the dice and moving around the board. Vacations, TVs and concert tickets are just a few of the possibilities to charge when players qualify for the Quik Charge, American Success, Recover and Bold Credit Cards.

Decide how to divide the payday cash between expenses, credit card debts or savings. Shoppers beware - it is easy to get caught in the alluring trap of unlimited purchasing power. Debts can pile up and the bank may revoke credit cards if payments are not made on time.

The object of Charge is to acquire the right combination of "paid up" credit cards, purchased items and cash. There may be some players who believe it is un-wise to have many credit cards. Some may fail to get good credit. These players may choose to win with one credit card, one purchased Item and $4,000 cash. Can you guess how the other players will try to win? Have fun!

97076.name: Faded Glory Rulebook
97076.description:
From the Introduction:

This rulebook should provide all that you need to know about the Faded Glory system from background information to creating your character. We will attempt to notify players of any changes to the rulebook and we will release updated rulebooks as often as we can.

97077.name: Middle-earth Role Playing Box Set (1st Edition)
97077.description:
This boxed MERP edition contains:
• 1st Edition MERP rulebook which includes the sample adventure Trollshaws.
• Map booklet which includes maps for the sample adventure and usage guidelines for counters.
• Full color counter sheet for use with Trollshaws adventure
• 2 d20 percentile dice (red & green)

NOTE: The counter sheet in this edition is a solid sheet and not die cut. The counters are also designed to lay flat rather than stand-up.

From the introduction:
The Middle-earth Role Playing system (MERP) is designed to introduce people to fantasy role playing (FRP) in J.R.R. Tolkien's Middle-earth. It is suitable for those who have never played a fantasy role playing game, as well as more experienced gamers who are looking for a realistic, easy to play fantasy role playing (FRP) system designed for relatively low level adventurers (1st-10th levels). It contains complete rules for handling most of the common situations that arise in FRP games, and a variety of tables that add a great deal of flavor and detail to a game without decreasing playability.

97078.name: Soul Magic
97078.description:
From the Introduction:

It was not so long ago that soul magic did not exist. Before the darkness arrived no one had heard of it, instead magic was gifted by gods to their followers. However shortly after the arrival of the darkness the gods seemed to turn their backs on their followers and their powers dwindled to nothing. Once the majority of the priestly magic had left the world the soul magic appeared from an unknown source.

Practitioners of this magic believe that their souls are directly linked to the world and through the world they are linked to the lives of everything and everyone. They believe that by drawing on the soul, they are drawing power in essence from the world and life itself in order to cast their spells. Soul magic, when compared to mage magic, is more limited as mages get more spells and are individually more powerful. However the benefit of soul magic is that two or more low level soul casters can "join" in casting a spell to gain a high-powered effect.

There are three types of Soul Casters:

Light Soul Magic
Light Soul Magic revolves around life and purity. Light soul casters cannot join with dark soul casters when trying to cast a spell to greater effect; they may only join with other light casters.

Dark Soul Magic
Dark Soul Magic revolves around corruption and death. Dark soul casters cannot join with light soul casters when trying to cast a spell to greater effect. They may only join with other dark casters.

Grey Soul Casters
Grey Soul Casters walk a fine line between life and death. They have a very balanced outlook on everything that they do, never favouring one or the other. You cannot become a grey caster; instead you must choose to be one when you create your character.

Unlike mages, the soul casters do not have to learn spells. Instead, when they reach a certain level of power, they gain all the standard powers that go with that level. There are rumours of additional powers that they may learn at higher levels but it is still a new type of magic and few, if any, have achieved a high level of mastery in it. The benefit of soul magic over mage magic is that soul casters can "join" when casting a spell. For example, if two second level casters joined to cast a spell they could duplicate the effect of a fourth level power that neither could cast alone.

97079.name: Psionic Powers
97079.description:
From the Introduction:

There are two types of psion in the world, wild psions and true psions.

True psions
It costs 6 points to become a true psion, this gets you three level 1 psionic abilities and 6 power points with which to power these abilities.

When you create your psion you must choose one specialist school which you are very good at using and one trouble school you have great difficulty using. Your three starting level powers must be from your specialist school. You may not start with any level 2 powers. The general sphere cannot be chosen as specialist or opposite and always costs the cheapest cost to purchase from. True psions cannot be mages or soul casters

Wild Psions

The wild psion ability can be bought by any class and costs 4 points. The three points gain you one level one ability and three psi points per day with which to use it. A character with a wild psion ability does NOT count as having a secondary class psion. Mages and soul casters can have wild psion powers. Wild psions only regenerate psi points through a good nights sleep and as such once they have used their three psi points they cannot regain them until the following day. Wild psions may not purchase additional psi points. Wild psions may also never attain abilities of greater than level 1.

Wild psions that wish to increase their powers may do one of two things

1st they can purchase the wild psion skill again and get another level 1 power and another 3 points to use it with. Characters may buy the wild psion skill as many times as they like.

2nd they can spend another 4 points on the wild psion skill and make themselves up to a full psion, this makes them a full psion with psion as their secondary class. Mages and soul casters with wild psion powers CANNOT take this option.

97080.name: Dealer's Choice
97080.description:
Players lays the tiles on the gameboard playing:
Gin Rummy, Canasta, Poker, Fan Tan, Black Jack and Solitaire.
Some bonus squares in the game board are marked as cards and if players place the tile to any of this bonus squares they recieve high score.

Components:

game board
108 tiles, equal to two decks of cards, plus four jokers
4 tile racks.

97081.name: Advanced Warrior Skills
97081.description:
User Summary:

Additional skills available for purchase for characters with the warrior class by permission from the ref team. New skills include:

Weapon Journeyman, Weapon Master, Advanced Weapons Initiate
Ambidextrous Weapon Initiate, Ambidextrous Weapons Journeyman, Ambidextrous Weapons Master
Armour Proficiency Initiate, Armour Proficiency Journeyman, Armour Proficiency Mastery, Defensive Mastery

97082.name: Advanced Soul Caster Skills
97082.description:
User Summary:

Additional skills available for purchase for characters with the soul caster class by permission from the ref team. New skills include:

Misbalance Spirit
Transcend Armour

97083.name: Advanced Thief Skills
97083.description:
User Summary:

Additional skills available for purchase for characters with the thief class by permission from the ref team. New skills include:

Agility 1, Agility 2
Move in Shadows
Move in Woodland
Detect Advanced Traps, Detect Magical Traps
Disarm Advanced Traps, Circumvent Magical Traps
Pick Advanced Locks, Pick Magical Locks
Precise Blade 2, Precise Blade 3
Featherfoot

97084.name: Advanced Mage Skills
97084.description:
User Summary:

Additional skills available for purchase for characters with the mage class by permission from the ref team. New skills include:

Make Scroll per Level
Identify Basic Item
Identify Medium Item
Identify Complex Item

97085.name: Advanced General Skills
97085.description:
User Summary:

Additional skills available for purchase for characters of any class by permission from the ref team. New skills include:

First Aid 3, First Aid 4, First Aid 5
Disguise
Double Strength
Fortitude

97086.name: Restricted Races
97086.description:
From the Introduction:

Restricted Races are races that players have requested to play at one time or another. Other players may play these races with agreement from the system refs before character creation.


User Summary:

Additional races included in this supplement are:

Kender
Orog (half-breed orc/ogre)
Troll




Additionally there is a list of "Denied Races" that explicitly cannot be taken as starting characters.

97087.name: Ferals
97087.description:
From the Introduction:

The Ferals are a diverse race each one having the characteristics of an animal. We have not defined all types of Feral but those we have defined and those that get defined as they are played will be listed here with their racial skill.


User Summary:

This supplement specifies the racial advantages of several specific species of Ferals:

Panther Feral
Dog Feral
Bat Feral
Arctic Fox Feral
Boar Feral

97088.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Features these three classic GHOULASH scenarios: "Now, Where Was I?" "Password" and "Pyramid Scheme".

SCENARIO: NOW, WHERE WAS I?

Warp zones keep you starting over time and again.

SCENARIO: PASSWORD

It's a Ghoul hunt! No, it's a word puzzle! No, it's both!

SCENARIO: PYRAMID SCHEME

No mummies in this pyramid, just plenty of Ghouls!
97088.name: Ghoulash: Scenario Pack 3

97089.name: Damage Calls
97089.description:
User Summary:

A system summary guide to the various calls that may be made using the Faded Glory system. These are split by:

Magical Damage Calls: Stone, Lightning, Cold, Flame, Light, Dark, Holy, Unholy, Artefact
Non Magical Calls: Enchanted, Silver, Celestial

97090.name: The Gauntlet
97090.description:
From Publisher Website

Set in East Texas and moving to Northern Mexico, The Gauntlet sees the player-characters in the ruined world twenty years after a nuclear war has destroyed most of civilization. They begin as captive serfs in a neo-feudal society and must escape from this state of near-slavery and then find purpose for their lives. Offered the opportunity to bring needed technology to one of the few remaining areas attempting to restore a technological society in Matamoros, Mexico, the characters may choose to attempt to carry the vital communications technology through hostile societies and past raiding groups along the Gulf Coast of Texas and into Northern Mexico. Hostile humans, dangerous beasts, mutated creatures, radioactive wastes, disease, and even the scarcity of the basic necessities like food and clean water make for a challenging quest. Will the player-characters be able to succeed in the face of the dangers and shortages they will encounter? An exciting campaign for the AFTERMATH! game system.

97091.name: Challenge Magazine CD-ROM: Issues 25-77
97091.description:
From the back of the box:
The complete original print run of Challenge Magazine, scanned from the original copies in the GDW Game Designers Workshop reference library.
Includes Issue 25 (the first in the series) through Issue 77 (the last published). Plus the forecast Table of Contents for issue 78 (although those articles we're never published), and a comprehensive index of Challenge Magazine and its pre-decessor magazine Journal of the Travellers Aid Society.

Challenge Magazine included article coverage for all of GDW's role-playing games: Traveller, Twilight: 2000, 2300 AD, Space: 1889, Cadillacs and Dinosaurs, Dark Conspiracy, and Dangerous Journeys, plus other non-GDW game systems.

97092.name: Cathay: The Five Kingdoms Gamemaster's Guide
97092.description:
(from the back of the book)

The Five Kingdoms

For centuries, the lands of the west have been enthralled by tales about the mystical province of Cathay. Far to the east, this mysterious place has always been a symbol of intrigue and wonder. Now, the door to the East is open.

From the lightning-born storm children, to the renowned Xan monks, Cathay's secrets can finally be explored by those brave enough to venture into this troubled, war-torn realm.

The Cathay: The Five Kingdoms Gamemaster's Guide is a sourcebook for Earthdawn Third Edition, containing everything a gamemaster needs for running adventures in the Five Kingdoms of Cathay - extensive setting material, guidelines for creating adventures and campaigns, information on creatures, dragons, Horrors, spirits, magical treasures, and much more!
Requires use of the Earthdawn Player's and Gamemaster's Guides.

97093.name: Cherokee
97093.description:
After the death of Yonaguska, the Cherokee tribe meets to select a new leader. As always with the Native Americans, the wise elders have the most influence and occupy the highest positions in the hierarchy. Due to their old age, however, they are also vulnerable to the youngsters, who want to take their place and will not hesitate to challenge their opponents. Which clan can obtain the most feathers and thus select the new leader?

In Cherokee, players try to occupy the most and highest positions in the hierarchy with their clan members. On a turn, a player chases away one member in the pyramid of cards, which represents the hierarchy of the tribe. This gap is then filled with one successor from below, with that gap being filled likewise. At the end of a turn, the player adds one card from his hand to the final gap in the base of the pyramid.

Cherokee is a game of paranoia – which colors are your enemies?

97094.name: Dark Minions
97094.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Hordes of dark minions have descended upon the countryside, eager to secure their reputation as a scourge on mankind. The despicable evil marauders attack everywhere in search of conquest. The citizens are helpless and will soon be overwhelmed. Death and destruction awaits all those in the path of the evil ones.

In Dark Minions players represent those forces of evil as they try to pillage and destroy towns. Each turn, the players typically roll three dice and may use the resulting numbers to attack Towns to win Vanquish Points (VPs) – the further along into the game, the more VPs the Towns are worth. Players also attempt to capture Towers in order to level up experience (which enables the player to roll better dice), to re-spawn dead minions from the graveyard, and to "purchase" the services of the various Overlords. In the end, it's all about VPs and the first player to 40 VPs in a four-player game wins.

The advanced game adds 15 Minion Overlords, each with a unique special power that may affect the play or the outcome of the game. They patiently wait to enter play and wreak their terrible havoc. Using their abilities wisely is one of the many keys to victory.

Dark Minions includes a small expansion called Demon Lords that adds more Overlords, a special town tile, and a special die – making for many ways to mix up the game play!

97095.name: Hedgebrew Potions
97095.description:
From the Introduction:

These are hedgebrew potions that are common enough that most people can purchase them should they need to.


User Summary:

Details of various potions are given in this supplement including:

Gypsy
Zevous
Meana
Ashuta
Witch wonder
Wenaustra
Di-zing
Minotaur
Ghost
Fun beans
Muta
Truth Sayer
Soulfire
Oix
Lions Heart
Red Weed

97096.name: Alchemy Potions
97096.description:
From the Introduction:

These are alchemy based potions that are common enough that most people can purchase them should they need to.


User Summary:

Details of various potions are given in this supplement including:

Blinding Dust
Paluse
Scratch dust
Moon Bottle
Akusa
Woodstone
Oil of Fire resistance
Oil of Water resistance
Oil of Air resistance
Oil of Earth resistance
Oil of Fire vulnerability
Oil of Water vulnerability
Oil of Air vulnerability
Oil of Earth vulnerability
Stiffener

97097.name: Herbal Potions
97097.description:
From the Introduction:

These are herbal based potions that are common enough that most people can purchase them should they need to.


User Summary:

Details of various potions are given in this supplement including:

Oris
Aku
Orange stalk
Calisoph

97098.name: Poisons
97098.description:
From the Introduction:

These are poisons that it is possible to obtain if you know the right people. Be aware possession of any of these is illegal.


User Summary:

Details of various potions are given in this supplement including:

Kora
Sete
Turmic

Derth

97099.name: Crime and Punishment
97099.description:
From the Introduction:

The old legal system in the Protected Zone had been found to be patchy and hard to enforce. Therefore the council of 14 have agreed to implement a new system to rectify this and to make the Protected Zone a safer place for all.

In the new system, the newly created Brehon Guild will be responsible for upholding the new laws and there are many new laws covering a lot of crimes that were previously lumped together or ill defined.

97100.name: Wayfinder (Issue 3 - Jun 2010)
97100.description:
From the Paizo website:

Created for fans by fans, this issue of the Wayfinder fanzine includes dozens of articles designed to expand the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and the world of Golarion. Inside you will find original fiction, new races, monsters, recipes, poetry—and this is just a small portion of what awaits you!

Wayfinder is a 104-page full-color PDF suitable for printing or viewing on your computer. It is released under the Paizo Publishing, LLC Community Use Policy.

97101.name: Hot Shot Basketball
97101.description:
Based on the classic midway arcade game, the object of Hot Shot Basketball game is to either score the most points in 60 seconds or score 10 baskets in the least amount of time. The game features switch positions and buttons on the backboard that give you lots of options to "put it up" for points!

You can choose between 2 skill levels and 2 games...and choose whether or not you want sound effects!

For 1 or more players.

97103.name: Springrings
97103.description:
From the box:
All You have to do is to put a ring on that funny little tin ring fixed to the ring and the press down the spring with Your finger and let it go suddenly. Up goes the ring and it falls on that pretty board with different colored divisions. If the ring falls into one of the 6 divisions it scores the number marked thereon. If You are lucky Your ring falls over the peg and then, You score the number of points marked in the centre. It is real fun to see who can score the highest number in a certain number of rounds.

97105.name: Cthulhu by Gaslight (3rd Edition)

rpghonor.20188: 2012 ENnie for Best Cover Art - Silver Winner

97105.description:
From the publisher:

Victorian England. The era of Sherlock Holmes and Dracula, and a horrific real-life mystery in the form of Jack the Ripper. Thousands of books, films, and stories have featured these characters over the past 120+ years -- Holmes and Dracula have become the most commonly-used fictional characters of all time. Little wonder then that this era, with its foggy atmosphere, gross social and economic inequality, and the vast history of England to draw from, should spawn a setting for Call of Cthulhu. For what is Call of Cthulhu if not the first truly great roleplaying game combining mystery and horror?

This new edition of Cthulhu by Gaslight has been thoroughly revamped, expanding the book by nearly 50% and adding new material roughly equivalent to the original book’s length. We have more thoroughly developed the Victorian England setting. Character creation has been reworked, with some new wrinkles added, and there are new articles on the Victorian world, crime, politics, personalities, and so forth. There are also extensive new sections on the Cthulhu Mythos in Britain -- creatures, cults, books, etc. -- including a précis of Ramsey Campbell’s Severn River Valley. Also included are tips on running various types of Gaslight era campaigns, a gazetteer of intriguing British myths and legends, a selection of friends and foes from Victorian fiction, and a lengthy new bibliography/filmography of suggested reading and viewing. Rounding out this new edition are a pair of new Victorian era scenarios -- one an urban adventure set in London, the other set in rural Dartmoor.

97106.name: Freebooter: The Pirate LRP System
97106.description:
From the Introduction:

I offer this system as one way we could do a Freebooter LRP system, based on the way we generally play so far, but a little more formalized. I am handing out copies to FBA members as I see them, with the intent that anyone with any constructive criticism gets back to me so I can alter the system accordingly. I don't have any particular egotism invested in this document (well, no more than usual anyway) so I'm quite happy to see it changed completely- I just thought it would be good if someone made a start so we can all put our ideas into it. I'd particularly like any suggestions on the firearms stats- anything I didn't know I just made up. Please feel free to copy this and hand it on to other FBA members, or use it to run non-commercial adventures.

I owe a debt of gratitude to all the Crew, who over the years have made us what we are, and without whom the document you hold in your hands would never have existed. Which would probably have been a very good thing. In particular, sources of inspiration for some bits of the rules have come from the Behind the Mask system, the Pressgang system, and Cadfannon`s strange ideas about a tabletop pirate RPG. The opening quote, and any others not attributed otherwise, is from Tim Powers' fine pirate novel On Stranger Tides. Quotes with a little 1 after them are from David Cordingly's Life Among the Pirates, whilst little 2s signify a quote from George MacDonald Fraser's The Pyrates.

97107.name: Runic Magic System for use in L.R.P
97107.description:
From the Introduction:

This magic system is an open system allowing players to create and customise their spells within a framework to maintain rules integrity. This is achieved by using a 'magic' language made up of runes. By putting together a logical group of runes a character can create a spell.

Casting runes involves a somatic and verbal component for each rune used in a spell, in addition to this some of the runes used, mainly the runes that give the spell its power, require a material component as well. Also to limit the number of spells a magic user can cast each rune cost the player a power point to use, each player having a predetermined amount of these power points, dependent on the characters level of experience in runic magic.

So to successfully cast a spell involving a number of different runes a player has to go through a reasonably involved process, the more powerful the spell generally the more runes so therefore a more involved casting process.

97108.description:
"BattleTech Starter: Fist and Falcon brings players a new and exciting way to jump into the BattleTech universe. As conflict erupts anew on the Lyran-Falcon border during the early years of the Jihad, two untested commands clash. Including the brief history and personal dossiers of the members of these two forces, this PDF provides scenarios and special rules compatible with BattleTech games using Total Warfare and A Time of War, complete with record sheets for their ’Mechs and characters alike."
- From www.classicbattletech.com

BattleTech Starter: Fist and Falcon presents a short campaign of linked missions for BattleTech. One player plays the Kewran Wolfhounds, a company from the Lyran Alliance, while the other plays the Pursuing Peregrines, a binary from the Jade Falcons. The player forces largely match up with the two packages of BattleForce-scale miniatures to be released by Iron Wind Metals in mid-2011.

Unlike BattleTech Starterbook: Sword and Dragon or BattleTech Starterbooks: Wolf and Blake, this product is a linear campaign. This product does not use the Chaos Campaign rules or missions from other books - it only requires Total Warfare to play.
97108.name: BattleTech Starter: Fist and Falcon

97109.name: Wayfinder (Issue 4 - Mar 2011)
97109.description:
From the Paizo website:

Created for fans by fans, this issue of the Wayfinder fanzine includes dozens of articles designed to expand the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and the world of Golarion. Inside you will find original fiction, new races, monsters, recipes, poetry and this is just a small portion of what awaits you!
