This player chooses a card, and passes the cards around the table, so that there are a dwindling number of choices. As players collect sets, these are played in to clear space in a player's hand. Each player has a hand-limit of 5 cards. If any player exceeds the number of cards he can hold, the team is defeated. If all 72 cards are either held (without exceeding hand-limit) or presented in sets, all players win.

MICROBADGE NOW ABAILABLE!
Nova's Ark Fan
97312.name: Nova's Ark

97313.name: Imperial Small Craft Vol. 2
97313.description:
Starship deck plans in 25mm scale.

From the back cover:
Starships may be glamorous, but the small craft are the backbone of interplanetary travel in star systems throughout the vast reaches of space. They ply the shipping lanes between the planets, making deliveries and running errands; generally doing much of the work a larger vessel can't or won't do. So when shuttling an exploration party, piloting a ship's launch, or ferrying cargo aboard the stalwart vessels of Imperial Small Craft, be prepared for what may await.

97314.description:
Excerpted from the back of the book

Special Tactics Issue

Featured Scenarios: The Orions engage in a tractor pull over an alien derelict. The scout Crockett duels with a Romulan Frigate. Romulan fighters attack a Gorn squadron. Klingon PFs track a Federation saucer. Klingon and Kzinti squadrons battle in an Ion Storm. The Coalition and Alliance battle in the last stages of Operation Cavalry.

Also features: Tactics, New Hydran SSDs, Federation & Empire Q&A, Fiction, info on Doomsday edition of SFB, & a preview of the Prime Directive RPG.
97314.name: Captain's Log #10

97315.description:
Excerpted from the back of the book

Origins of the General War!

Featured Scenarios: Kzinti and Lyran cruisers square off in Cold Front. Orions rescue Hamilcar's son from the Klingons. WYN and Kzinti frigates battle on the edge of the radiation zone. Klingons ambush two Fed cruisers, and discovers on is a CX! Two Gorn X-ships pursue a Romulan ThunderHawk. An ISC squadron pursues the Hydrans into the rings.

Also includes... Cold Front (a history of the Coalition, the Kzintis, & the Hydrans); Universe (information about Doomsday edition & Prime Directive RPG); Tactics; Federation & Empire Q&A; two new X-Ship SSDs; and more.
97315.name: Captain's Log #11

97316.name: Boy Crazy
97316.description:
Boy Crazy is a simple collectible card game for girls, created by Decipher Inc. during the Pokémon Trading Card Game boom.

Cards are distributed in packs of 9 cards. Each card featured a picture of a boy aged 12–22, his first name, set of statistics about him (height, date of birth, color of eyes), and a list of his likes and dislikes. Cards includes boys from across the United States, from different ethnic backgrounds and hair and eye colors, including disabled boys.

Game is basically a very simple matchmaking game. Minimum requirements for game are at least 9 cards, and each player should have pencil and paper. Play begins when players decide who gets to go first. Using the Boy Crazy cards (9 cards or more), first player secretly writes down which boy she likes best and why. Then the first player lays out the cards so everyone can see them. The other players try to make a match by writing who they think is the best boy for the first player and why. Then, each of the other players take turns revealing who they chose as her match. After the first player reveals her response, scores are tabulated for that round. Each player who correctly matches the first player's response scores a point. Play continues until every girl has a chance for her friends to guess her match. To start a new round players should discard starting set of 9 cards and draw a new set of 9 cards. The player or players who makes the most correct guesses wins.

The game was so popular that Decipher launched a companion "Boy Crazy" magazine in September 2001.

97319.name: Avadon: The Black Fortress
97319.description:
Spiderweb Software brings you Avadon: The Black Fortress, the first chapter in a new, epic fantasy saga. You will serve the keep of Avadon, working as a spy and warrior to fight the enemies of your homeland. As a servant of the Black Fortress, your word is law. Experience an exciting fantasy role-playing adventure and battle a conspiracy to destroy your people.

Avadon: The Black Fortress Features:


Epic fantasy role-playing adventure in an enormous and unique world.
Four different character classes, with dozens of unique spells and abilities.
Uncover the fascinating history of Avadon and the land of Lynaeus.
Many different endings. Your choices will change the world.
Dozens of side quests, hidden dungeons, and secrets to discover.
Hundreds of magical items to find. Use powerful crystals to make your artifacts even more powerful.
Huge adventure with lots of replay value.


Source: The Developer Website.

97321.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 165 - Jul 2010)
97321.description:
Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine
Issue #165
July 2010

The Better Part of Valor

Cover art by George Vrbanic and Jackie Vrbanic.

97322.name: Heartlands Rulebook
97322.description:
From the Introduction:

The idea behind Heartlands is to stand alone rule wise while keeping in mind several others LARP groups many of our players attend and allowing an ease of transition between them to avoid confusion. The core group behind Heartlands previously worked on and ran other LARP systems and used this experience in the design.

Unlike some larger LARP systems, where characters tend form a number of different factions or groups which interact with each other, while sometimes facing off against other creatures, Heartlands style our games differently. Typically our events and games focus on a party of characters undergoing a mission or task, facing and attempting to overcome opponents, traps and monsters which are in their way. Most other factions and groups encountered will be NPC's.

This means that all the action and encounters will involve everyone who attends and the characters played are often in the middle of things and able to get straight into events without difficulty or missed opportunities.

97323.name: Sword & Spell
97323.description:
from the introduction:
Sword & Spell (version 1.2) is an alternate version of Xavier Raoult’s Warriors, Wizards and Wanderers fantasy role-playing game (or FRPG). While WWW is a simple and flexible system to play, I found myself creating a lot of house rules as I went along. Eventually the rules I had downloaded and printed became a mess of black marker and footnotes. It was time to rewrite and reorganise and the result is Sword & Spell.

97324.name: Cthulhu Risus
97324.description:
introduction:
I love gaming in a Cthulhuesque universe, but something one quickly learns about such a setting is that the lifespan of a typical character is quite short, and sooner or later they'll wind up either drooling-at-the-mouth insane, gorily sacrificed by a cultist, or ingested by some nameless tentacled horror. It is hard to spend an hour creating a character knowing the great likelihood of their eventual fate, and even harder to justify spending another hour on a new character after your previous one has just been rent limb-from-limb by a shoggoth while on his first adventure.
Hence, here is my proposed solution: use Risus as the gaming engine! It is hard to find a setting better suited for 30 second character creation than the Cthulhu Mythos. Even if your character just got eaten, sacrificed, or pulled into an alternate dimension, a new character is just a few seconds away. The advantages of this should be clear.

97325.description:
From the back of the cover:

Road to Baghdad gives Force on Force players all the information they need to re-fight the 2003 Allied Invasion of Iraq. From deadly little firefights between Iraqi Fedayeen and US Special Forces to armored strikes against Republican Guard positions across the Tigris River, Road to Baghdad offers a wealth of varied scenarios and mission objectives that will challenge the tactical abilities of new and experienced wargamers alike. With a wealth of new information to expand Force on Force, including detailed historical background and orders of battle for US, British, and Iraqi forces during the invasion, Road to baghdad allows players to really get to grips with the experience of war in the opening stages of Operation Iraqi Freedom.
97325.name: Force on Force: Road to Baghdad – Iraq 2003

97326.name: Big Fish Little Fish
97326.description:
A trick-taking game for traditional playing cards. Features 'boasting' - a push-your-luck mechanic.

Each round, an auction is held for the right to be 'big fish', who will have a better hand and should win more tricks than any little fish. Unlike other card games, you bid points of your score - being a big fish carries a greater element of risk, since you need to regain at least the points you just lost in the auction.

A game lasts around 4-6 rounds, decided in advance. For 2 players, 4 rounds are recommended.

summary of a round:
- DEAL 6 cards to each player. Deal out a face-up 'dummy hand' of 6 cards.

- Have an AUCTION for the right to be big fish. The winning bid is deducted from the big fish's score.

- BIG FISH declares the trump suit, then exchanges any number of cards from their hand with cards from the extra hand.

- Each player BOASTS how many tricks they will win.

- Starting with Big Fish, PLAY out the 6 tricks. There is no need to follow suit and the first-played suit has no special significance.

- Players who took fewer tricks than their boast win nothing. Players who win at least as many as their boast SCORE points equal to their boast squared.

97327.name: Big Buck Hunter
97327.description:
The game centers around a player's ability to shoot up to three bucks a stage without shooting a doe or female animal, thus ending the player's turn prematurely. Later versions such as Big Buck Hunter Pro and Big Buck Safari also allow for critter shooting and trophy hunting (Safari only).

Source: Wikipedia, "Big Buck Hunter," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

97328.name: Onimusha Tactics
97328.description:
From the Rulebook:

ONI BLOOD... ONI GAUNTLET

The fearless warrior youth Onimaru hears word that his home, Iga, is in grave danger. Like the wind, he rushes home. "Please let them be alive!"

Once inside his village, Onimaru comes face to face with a group of grotesque demon-like characters--Genma! What is this?

Finall, Onimary is reunited with Iga's Ninja chief, Sandayu Momochi, and his sister, Oboro. The wise Sandayu tells the young warrior of the ongoing terror caused by the Genma King, Nobunaga Oda.

Then Sandayu reveals to Onimaru his ultimate destiny. A descendant of the mythical Oni Tribe, Onimaru must meet his destiny head on and fight the evil Genma armies. Sandayu bestows upon Onimaru the legendary Oni Gauntlet, a mystical glove with powers to aid him in his quest.

Onimaru bows his head. His fate is clear. He must go and fight the evil warlord and his hordes of Genma!

97329.description:
El Mundo de Águila Roja (The World of Red Eagle) is a collectable card game based on the popular TV series of Águila Roja, a success of TVE (Televisión Española) and the producer Globomedia. The TV serie present the adventures of a avenging hero with martial arts training in the spanish XVII century.

The game has been designed by Globomedia and developed by a group of experts in collectable card games directed by Omar Sagol and Joel Calafell.

The basic collection includes 154 cards with the places, characters and more emblematic events of the TV series. The game is based on four factions, each one of as it has his own thematic deck and way to get the victory:

- The manipulative Clergy
- The worker People
- The powerful Royalty
- The dark Conspirators.

The players must build a deck of 40 cards of his faction and neutral cards. This cards are played over the table to attack, defend, travel and activate special powers. The first player that reach 25 (or more) victory points and keep this avantage for one turn, will be the winner.

The games comes in 3 presentations:

- Starter Decks: with 2 ready-to-play decks. Each set presents 2 decks:"Conspirator & Royalty" and "Town & Clergy".
- Theme Decks: with one of the four factions in 56 cards decks.
- Booster Packs: with assorted 5 cards in common, uncommon and rare type card.


El Mundo de Aguila Roja es un Juego de Cartas Coleccionable (JCC) basado en la famosa serie de televisión española, ambientada en el siglo XVII y que narra las aventuras de un justiciero vengador con entrenamiento de artes marciales.

En este juego, los jugadores pueden escoger a que bando pertenecer: el Clero manipulador, la poderosa Casa Real, los oscuros Conspiradores o el trabajador Pueblo. Los jugadores deberán preparar un mazo de 40 cartas compuestas de Sucesos, Personajes y Lugares que irán jugando sobre la mesa para viajar, atacar, defenderse y activar habilidades especiales.

Cada bando tiene diferentes formas de conseguir la victoria que se consigue cuando uno de los jugadores alcanza 25 puntos o más y se mantiene victorioso un turno.

El juego viene en 3 presentaciones:

- Set de Iniciación para 2 jugadores. Cada set con 2 barajas "Conspiradores y Casa Real" y "Pueblo y Clero"
- Baraja temática: con cada una de las 4 facciones en barajas de 56 cartas.
- Sobres de refuerzo: con 5 cartas cada uno (rara, infrecuente y comunes).
97329.name: El mundo de Águila Roja

97330.name: Dissidia 012: Duodecim Final Fantasy
97330.description:
Dissidia 012 Final Fantasy​ is a 2011 fighting game published by Square Enix for the PlayStation Portable as part of the Final Fantasy series. It was developed by the company's 1st Production Department.The game is a follow-up to Dissidia: Final Fantasy, revealing what occurred before the events of its predecessor, and was released on March 22, 2011 in North America.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dissidia 012 Final Fantasy," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

97331.description:
Dealin' Damage adds a new level of detail to Outrider's damage track. Instead of just losing Armor Tokens, players can lose something crucial with each hit suffered. Tires blowout, engines sputter and stall, weapons jam and ultimately fail and your armor could shear off - taking parts of your car with it! Even the vehicle's driver isn't safe: one bullet could injure or outright kill the driver.

The Dealin' Damage Bolt-On contains rules, damage cards, targeted damage cards, critical effect cards as well as a set of smoke and debris markers to enhance gameplay.
97331.name: Outrider: Dealin' Damage

97332.description:
Publisher Introduction Game Overview:

This comprehensive play aid includes all the rules, updated with current errata, diagrams and detailed examples of frequently asked questions, as well as all of the encounters for the popular Malifaux skirmish game in an easily referenced compact form.

Are you willing to risk your soul for a chance at great wealth and power? It's your only weapon in a world rife wtih monsters, necropunks, man-machine hybrids, gunslingers, and power-hungry politicos. In Malifaux, you lead your crew in the battle for control of the Breach, a dark portal to a world of limitless magic. Those who don't make it become monsters you must destroy.

Malifaux is a character-driven 32mm tabletop miniatures game. Players lead groups, called Crews, in skirmish attacks against their opponents in the magical realm of Malifaux. Players collect, build, and paint models representing the denizens of Malifaux and pit these Crews against one another. Masters, powerful practitioners of magic, and those fighting them control these Crews.

Masters can manipulate the course of events in the world around them, and can change their own fates, through their control or theft of the powerful Soulstones in Malifaux. A Crew conssists of a variety of fantastic and frightening beings, collectively known as Minions, who serve the Master as fodder in his or her machinations. In addition, Henchmen can lead specialized Crews in their Master's absence, or serve their Master directly as a member of a Crew. Masters and Henchmen are also supported by Totems, extension of their magical abilities which increase their spellcasting range and provide additional aid in an Encounter.

How well a Crew carries out its leader's Strategy and Schemes determiens whether or not it will emerge victgorious in an Encounter with an enemy Crew. Strategies represent the Crew's main path to victory, while Schemes are simpler alternate routes to achieve the leader's goals.

Malifaxu players use decks of cards called Fate Decks to resolve game events such as attacking and spell casting. Players can manipulate the cards they play to alter the Duel's outcome. It takes a shrewd leader to effectively utilize a Crew's resources, ensuring he or she always has ready the cards needed to Cheat Fate.

Be Prepared to fight to the death because Malifaux is the end of the line!
97332.name: Malifaux Rules Manual

97336.name: Four in a Row 3D
97336.description: Four in a Row 3D! is a great two player game where both players try to make four in a row with their rings (one color for each of them). The first one to get four identical color beads in a row wins. This game is the same as the classic four in a row game except this time it is back in a new 3D form, 5x5x5 grid to add a new edge to the game.

97337.name: Red Sun
97337.description: This puzzle puts brain versus brain in the spot light. All around the red sun! In this game, two players must face off with each other. Each gets two pegs to use. Players take turn moving a peg from one of the holes to the other. The first player to make it so the other cannot move loses and will not get the glory of the red sun! It is a think quick act quick game. The rules do not allow for time to think and strategize. You must be on your toes and always think one step ahead!

97339.name: Compañeros
97339.description:
Compañeros is a trick-taking game that includes six colored suits of cards, each numbered 1 through 10. In the game, you use as many suits as the number of players participating.

Shuffle the cards, place a number of cards equal to the number of players face up on the table, then deal the remainder of the cards evenly amongst the players.

The starting player opens the trick by playing any card of his hand. The other players follow by playing any card from their hand. (Players are not obligated to match suit, and the game uses no trump.) After each player has played to the trick, the players add up the individual card values for each suit (color) separately.

The trick is won by the player(s) who have played a card in the color with the highest total. The player who played the highest card in that color gets to choose all cards of a color of his choice from the cards in the middle and keeps them as victory points. Then, the player with the second highest card in that color gets to choose, etc. Finally, the cards that were played during the trick are placed in the middle of the table for the next trick. If two or more colors are tied with high value, then no one who played in those colors (or any colors with a lower sum) scores any cards.

Once all nine tricks have been played, players add up the values of the cards they won during the game. The player with the highest total wins.

97340.name: Herreds-Nyt (Issue 3 - 1987)
97340.description:
User summary:

New NPC-race for AD&D, comment on a negative newspaperarticle, good advice for gamemasters, report from the Spiltræf '87 convention and more.

97341.name: Almanach nadzwyczajny
97341.description:
Publisher's blurb in Polish:

Kolejny dodatek do Wolsunga to tym razem 96 stron wypełnionych po brzegi wskazówkami do parowych graczy i Mistrzów Gry oraz nowymi zasadami, organizacjami, atutami, gadżetami... A to nie wszystko!

W podręczniku znaleźć można:

* dokładne opisy 4 teatrów działań na arenie politycznej Wanadii;
* rozszerzone zasady żywiołów, słabości rasowych, pościgów, pojazdów, kompletowania gadżetów, sojuszników i golemów;
* 14 dziedzictw rasowych, od alvarów po Windian;
* 6 nowych organizacji;
* 40 specjalności, po dwie dla każdej profesji;
* 49 atutów, 47 gadżetów i 23 osiągnięcia z wszystkich dziedzin życia;
* 13 wiernych sojuszników i golemów oraz 15 osobistości, które mogą stać się protektorami waszych bohaterów;
* 4 pomysły na kampanie i 44 pomysły na przygody.

Podręcznik wydany jest w takim samym formacie i na takim samym papierze co podręcznik główny i inne dodatki.

and the English translation:

Another expansion for Wolsung is this time a 96 pages long sourcebook filled with hints for steam players and game masters. Also there are included new rules, organizations, feats, gadgets... and that's not everything!

The sourcebook includes:

* a detailed description of four areas of political activities in Vanadia;
* expanded rules for elements, racial wekanesses, chases, vehicles, completing gadgets, allies and golems;
* 14 racial heritages, from alvars to Windian;
* 6 new organizations;
* 40 specializations, two for each profession;
* 49 traits, 47 gadgets and 23 achievements of all kind;
* 13 faithful allies and golems and 15 personalities which can become protectors of your heroes;
* 4 ideas for campaigns and 44 ideas for adventures

The format of the book is identical to the previous ones.

97342.name: Game System (Version 1)
97342.description:
From the Introduction:

A system based for a campaign in which resources are limited and metal armour such as chainmail and plate are expensive and uncommon.


From the Publisher's Website:

The rulebook details the game mechanics. Included are rules for character generation and progression. A new system still in development, amendments and changes are likely.

97343.name: The Murk Campaign
97343.description:
From the Introduction:

Spearhead LRP aim to provide quality live-roleplay events set in a unique, gritty, high fantasy campaign world, where every action has a consequence.

If you are new to live roleplay then you may initially find it all a bit confusing. Think of it as instead of controlling a character on a tabletop or in a computer game you actually don costume and armour, pick up a weapon and go on to act out your chosen character. As your character you work with other players to solve puzzles, trade, negotiate and when all goes wrong, defend yourself against often monstrous bad guys.

This campaign guide and the rulebook lay out the basics of the gameworld and the mechanics behind the events. Please take time to read through. If you have further questions, contact us and we’ll be happy to answer any queries. The website is a further source of information and by registering on the forums you can introduce yourself and garner further details.

97344.name: The Game System (Version 3)
97344.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

The rulebook details the game mechanics. Included are rules for character generation and progression.

97345.name: The Game System (Version 4)
97345.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

The rulebook details the game mechanics. Included are rules for character generation and progression.

97346.name: The Haven Campaign
97346.description:
From the Introduction:

The Spearhead LRP / Haven Rule Book set comprises:

Part I - The Land of Eden, is intended to describe the campaign world and the known history of Eden.

Part II - Haven, gives more detail of the actual area where the campaign is set.

Part III - The Game System, is intended to describe the mechanics that are used to represent the Land of Eden in terms of roleplay. Rules for character generation and progression are included.

97348.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Member of the prestigious Testarossa dynasty, one the most influential noble houses of Argos, the rebellious and stubborn Alis was always the source of problems for all her family because of her impetuous behaviour. When she was thirteen Alis began to manifest supernatural talents. Her parents, fearful of Alis bringing shame to the family, used their influence to send her to the church. There, Alis developed her skills under the supervision of the Knights of the Saint Order. When she was only 21 obtained the title of High Captain in recognition of her extraordinary abilities.

Thanks to her control over energy and her capability to manifest wings of light and soar upon the skies, she has become a legend of the Knights of the Saint Order, and some see her as a angel sent by heaven.

Warrior - Church - Level 40

Wings of Light: If Alis sacrifices 3 LP during the Maintenance Phase, she obtains the Flying skill during the rest of the turn.

Valkyrie (Ki, Charte) - +2 Attack / +2 Damage Alis must be Flying.

Aegis' Wind (Ki, Movement, Escape) - Alis automatically escapes Hand-to-Hand combat and may move up to 12 inches. This does not count as movement for the current turn. She may not engage in hand-to-hand combat using this movement action. Alis must be Flying.

Aegis (Ki, Attack) - +2 Attack / +2 Damage. If the attack causes damage, retire all Positive States from the enemy unit.

Beyond the Winds (KI, Charge) - Retire Alis from the board. During her activation in the following turn, place her in contact with any enemy unit in game and complete the Charge. Alis returns to the board with 0 action points. Alis must be Flying in the moment she uses this skill.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.
97348.name: Anima Tactics: Alis Testarossa

97349.description:
Players herd their sheep around the board to collect Clover Tiles and also score bonus points for completing sentences. This game teaches children educational skills such as forming basic sentences and completing sets. The game play involves light strategy and also allows children to practice early reading and simple math.

Publisher's Description:
A Grammar Game Your Family will Flock To

Collect the clovers with your sheep to form sentences. Score with each subject, verb, adjective, and object. You’ll laugh at the wacky sentences you create!

WHAT THEY'LL LEARN: Early Vocabulary, Strategy, Basic Sentence Structure
97349.name: Clover Leap

97350.name: Rolle og Brætspilsmagasinet Ravnen (Issue 7 - Autumn 1993)
97350.description: Issue 7 of Ravnen, new technology was the cause of many mistakes in this issue, among them no numbering on the cover.

97351.name: I. N. F. H. (Issue 6, Volume 3 - 1987)
97351.description: Convention report (Viking-Con VI), Fantasy films, Pendragon RPG, and more

97352.name: I. N. F. H. (Issue 3, Volume 4 - 1988)
97352.description:
User Summary

Half the fanzine was a convention magazine for Spiltræf '88. The other half was the regular INFH with film reviews, Blood Bowl tournaments, members list and reviews.

97353.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Few agents of Samael have proven as useful to the organization as the Sylvain Janiel Ul Del Valiem. Young even by the standards of her race, Janiel is both an incomparable spell caster and an unequaled martial artist in the service of the Fallen Angel Dinah. Her mystical abilities allow her to invoke into the world a guardian spirit named Enjeil, who takes the form of an enormous eagle made of energy, through which she manifests her powers. Any obscure power that underestimates her will meet its end in a flurry of feathers.

Warrior / Mystic - Samael - Level 40

Einjeil Eyes (Magic, Seek) - This ability gives +8 inches to Janiel's Control Zone and +1 to the success roll of the Seek Control.

The Mark of Einjeil (Magic, Effect) - Choose an enemy unit within 20 inches. Until the end of the turn, all Ranged Attacks of any friendly unit against that enemy gain +2 Attack. Effect 16.

Feathers Storm (Magic, Ranged Attack) - Distance (20 Inches), +2 Damage.

Feathers Slash (Ki, Attack) - +2 Attack / +2 Damage.

Healing Breath (Magic, Effect) - A friendly unit inside Janiel's Control Zone gains Lv 2 Healing.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.
97353.name: Anima Tactics: Janiel

97354.name: Mysticos X (Issue 10 - Dec 1995)
97354.description:
User summary:

Alternative rules for AD&D, club tournaments, Diplomacy guide, Fastaval '96 (convention) information and a report from the board meeting.

97355.name: Pegasus (Issue 15 - Winter 2004)

rpgissuearticle.45097: ...and Things That Go Bump in the Night - Gremlins

97355.description:
Pegasus
Issue #15
Winter 2004

Issued as PDF only.

Cover art by Stefan Poag.

97356.name: 50 Bar Encounters
97356.description:
Introduction:
What you hold in your hands right now is 50 great ideas. We're not into giving you pages and pages of stats (although we've got some stats in here). We're not looking to design you a whole world or shape your campaign (although there are a few great plot hooks in here). What we're about is fun. All we want to do is inspire you. So we give you 50 Bar Encounters.

147603.name: Sunrise City: Bonus Roles and Buildings

97357.description:
Game description from the publisher:

In the tile-laying game Sunrise City, players build a city with zone tiles, bid for control of those zones, then place building tiles on the city zones to their best advantage. Each round the players use role cards to grant them special abilities in the various game phases. Points earned during play move score tokens up a ten point track. Players score one benchmark token if their score marker overshoots the star at the top of their score track but earn two benchmarks if their token lands on the star by exact count.

Thus, Sunrise City is not a race to score the most points; it's a contest to grow the city in a manner that will earn you the right number of points at the right time to maximize your benchmarks. After three rounds, the player with the most benchmarks wins.
97357.name: Sunrise City

97358.name: The Steadfast Shield
97358.description:
Introduction:
Secrets deep within the abandoned temple are about to come lurching into the sunlight. The undead have a new master who needs only find the Ruby Key to unleash an ancient army of evil, dooming the people of Keaswauk County. The village of Tuvines is plagued with troubles. The harvest rots on the vine, as the people now fear to go out doors. Foul things that bay like dogs gone mad spirit away young men and women. Dark-shadowed forms are about, terrifying the good people of Tuvines and stirring up who knows what sort of mischief.

This adventure is designed to be an introduction to Dungeons and Dragons. It takes place at a holy temple, long ago abandoned. The temple is large enough that several different groups of creatures have come to call it "home" . The encounter levels range from 1 to 6, providing ample challenge to parties from 2nd to 4th level. A well- balanced party has the best chance of success in the Steadfast Shield. The undead figure prominently in the lower level, so it would be advisable for the GM to "bone up" on the uses of channeling positive and negative energy, as well as the specific monsters presented here.

rpgseries.26393: Walt Disney Choose Your Own Adventure

97360.name: Snow White in the Enchanted Forest
97360.description:
From the back of the book

Snow White is in trouble, and it's up to you to save her from the evil Queen! Snow White has fled to the Enchanted Forest to escape the angry Queen. One day you lose your way and find yourself in- the Enchanted Forest! Suddenly you hear singing coming from up ahead. Than a twig snaps behind you. You don't see a thing. What should you do?

rpgseries.26393: Walt Disney Choose Your Own Adventure

97361.name: Pinocchio's Adventures
97361.description:
From the back of the book

Pinocchio is headed for danger and only Jiminy Cricket- and you- can save him! Pinnocchio has been sent to Pleasure Island by two rascals, J. Worthington Foulfellow the Fox and Gideon the Cat. Pleasure Island is a big amusement park that looks like lots of fun- but it's a dangerous place! Now Pinocchio is about to go into the Fun House. You want to go in, but it looks a little scary. What should you do?

rpgseries.26393: Walt Disney Choose Your Own Adventure

97362.name: Dumbo's Circus
97362.description:
From the back of the book

There's high-flying fun at Dumbo's circus. You have gone to the circus to see Dumbo, the famous flying elephant. As a special treat, Dumbo asks you to go flying with him. Soon both of you are soaring among the clouds- when suddenely a bad thunderstorm comes rumbling up over the mountain ahead. What should you do?

rpgseries.26393: Walt Disney Choose Your Own Adventure

97363.name: Cinderella's Magic Adventure
97363.description:
From the back of the book

Cinderella wants to go to the Prince's ball, and it's up to you to help her! You are on your way to the Prince's ball, when your coach passes a young girl sitting on the bench, crying. She tells you her name is Cinderella and that she is unhappy because her stepmother and stepsisters won't let her go to the ball. You want to help her- but what can you do?

rpgseries.26393: Walt Disney Choose Your Own Adventure

97364.name: Alice's Wonderland Adventure
97364.description:
From the back of the book

Alice has a new friend in Wonderland- you! One summer day you're taking a nap by a riverbank. You wake up to see a girl chasing a white rabbit into a nearby hole. You follow them- and find yourself falling through space! When you land, you are only a few inches tall. You've fallen into Wonderland with Alice and the White Rabbit!

rpgseries.26393: Walt Disney Choose Your Own Adventure

97365.name: Sleeping Beauty and the Prince
97365.description:
From the back of the book

A beautiful princess lies fast asleep in her palace. Only the Prince's kiss can wake her from the spell of the evil witch Maleficent. But the Prince will face terrible dangers on the way to the palace! Do you dare to rescue Sleeping Beauty with him?

rpgseries.26393: Walt Disney Choose Your Own Adventure

97366.name: Peter Pan in Never Land
97366.description:
From the back of the book

Fly away with Peter Pan on an adventure in Never Land! One night your just about to fall asleep when -Thump!- a boy lands on your window sill. It's Peter Pan and with him is the tiny fairy, Tinker Bell. When they sprinkle you with fairy dust, your suddenly flying! And when you look down, you see Never Land! It's the most amazing place you've ever seen. Where should you go first?

97367.name: Jungle Book Adventure

rpgseries.26393: Walt Disney Choose Your Own Adventure

97367.description:
From the back of the book

Can you and Mowgli survive the dangers of your jungle adventure? One day you chase a mongoose deep into the forest near your village. You are lost! You look up just in time to see a jungle boy waving to you from behind a tree. Suddenly there is a wild rustling of leaves it's Shere-Khan, the man-hating tiger! What should you do?

rpgseries.26393: Walt Disney Choose Your Own Adventure

97368.name: Mickey's Christmas Carol Adventure
97368.description:
From the back of the book

You're about to spend Christmas eve with Scrooge- and a ghost! It's Christmas eve. Old Ebenezer Scrooge has dropped his watch in the snow, and you've followed him to his scary-looking house to give it back. You walk up the stairs to Scrooge's bedroom and peek through the keyhole. Oh, no! He's talking to a ghost! What should you do?

97369.name: Wind in the Willows Adventure

rpgseries.26393: Walt Disney Choose Your Own Adventure

97369.description:
From the back of the book

Can you and your friends rescue Mr. Toad? Your friend Mr. Toad has been thrown in jail for stealing a car. You know he is innocent, and it's up to you to get him out! You sneak up to the prison in the middle of the night. But there is a mean-looking guard in front of the gate! What should you do?

97370.name: Bambi's Woodland Adventure

rpgseries.26393: Walt Disney Choose Your Own Adventure

97370.description:
From the back of the book

Bambi's forest is in danger-and you can help save it! The hunters have returned to the forest! And now your new friends, the woodland animals, are all in danger. Bambi is determined to save Faline, his special friend. But who will warn the others about the hunters?

97371.name: Winnie-the-Pooh and His Friends

rpgseries.26393: Walt Disney Choose Your Own Adventure

97371.description:
From the back of the book

Little Roo is lost, and only Winnie-the-Pooh and you-can find him! Roo is lost in the hundred acre wood. Christopher Robin sends you, Kanga, Piglet and Pooh to find him. But suddenly a thick fog rolls in. You could get lost too- and there are Heffalumps and Woozles all around. Who should lead the way?

97372.name: Twin Sector
97372.description:
Back of Box:

Twin sector takes place in a post-apocalyptic future where the remains of mankind have been put to artificial sleep in cryogenic chambers deep under the contaminated surface of earth - until the planet becomes habitable again. You as the player must take the role of Ashley Simms, the protagonist of Twin Sector. Suddenly awakened by the stations security A.I. system O.S.C.A.R., you face imminent extinction like all other still sleeping survivors due to an unknown failure in the life support system.

97373.name: The Colour of Magic
97373.description:
User Summary

The Colour of Magic is a text adventure game based on the first Discworld novel: The Colour of Magic, by Terry Pratchett. It was the first Discworld video game, and remains the only game directly based on one of the novels.

97376.name: Wizkids DVD board game
97376.description:
From the publisher:
Wizkids is the DVD board game that teases your brain. Wizkids is about science and technology with bizarre trivia and experiments. Wizkids is fast, explosive, varied and enormously interesting.

Challenge each other in five different categories and train your brain. The DVD gives you and your fellow players directions in the form of films, photos and animations about the most unusual subjects. With more than 800 extraordinary trivia!

Do you have the brains of a prawn or are you much smarter that the rest? Do you know more? Can you calculate faster, draw better and remember or recognize more? than you will certainly win the game!

112943.name: Hail Caesar Army Lists: Biblical & Classical

boardgamecompilation.204793: Hail Caesar:  The Conquest of Gaul

boardgamehonor.20973: 2011 Best Historical Miniatures Rules or Expansion Nominee

97377.description: Battles with model soldiers in the ancient era. These rules describe the Hail Caesar game with all the fundamentals of ancient warfare such as troops, manoeuvre, missile fire, morale and close quarter combat. Detailed rules cover the differences in methods of fighting from the age of the chariot to medieval times.
97377.name: Hail Caesar

97378.name: minifig World: BATTLELINES
97378.description:
BATTLELINES is a collectible card game based on LEGO miniatures. However using miniatures is not required for game play.

Each Character card represents a miniature of miniFig World. Other cards types include Equipment and Weapons.

The game play is simple and battles are resolved with a dice D6. It is a 2 player game, with a customizable deck.
BATTLELINES uses a unique system to keep track of Characters Ammo and Health using LEGO studs attached to each Character card.

Legendary miniFig Characters like "Brodie SARGE Munro" battle against each other using their Power (PWR) and Defence (DEF) and whatever Equipment or Weapons are available to beat their opponents.

miniFig World is an Australian based internet business which specialises in LEGO miniatures and accessories.

97379.name: Little Noddy Car Game

boardgameartist.51657: Eelco Martinus ten Harmsen van der Beek

97379.description:
A simple race game from the early 50's. Players are trying to get to the Station first. Throw a die and move. You must obey the instructions on the square that you land on. For example, A Flat Tyre on space 44, which makes you go back to 33. Or a Green Traffic Light on space 16, which means you can quickly proceed to 21.
Traditional rules such as 'Have another turn if you throw a 6' and 'You need the exact throw to finish'.
A nice touch is the provision of a box to keep your pieces in. The pieces are 4 cars and a die.

97380.name: Banzai Rabbit
97380.description:
User Summary

Banzai Rabbit is a game that borrows it's main gameplay mechanic from the classic game Frogger. In this type of game, you must dodge obstacles in an attempt to get from one side of the screen to the other.

In Banzai Rabbit, you play as a scientist who - in a freak accident - became transformed into a human-rabbit hybrid. You must traverse dangerous roads without getting run over, in order to save humans who are in the midst of being transformed themselves.

boardgamehonor.12701: 2010 Vuoden Peli Family Game of the Year Nominee

97381.name: Hoksotin
97381.description:
Hoksotin is a game where you spin a Twister-type spinner, that tells you what you'll need to find from the board, for example you'll have to find "Something round". In limited time you'll try and find as many round things as possible, marking the ones you already found with sticky little chips in you color. When the time runs out the chips are removed and correct ones are scored on your personal scoreboard. The one that gets most points in the limited number of rounds is the winner. There are 3 different two-sided boards with the art that is very appealing to the children.

Hoksotin was one of the finalists in the "Vuoden perhepeli 2010" -competion. (The Best Family Game of 2010).

97382.name: Daredevil Smith
97382.description:
A game which starts the same way but then the board tiles shift and each game is now unique.
'For 2 to 4 Adventurers' say the rules. You are dealt 3 room Cards and it is your objective to 'dynamite' each room so named. If you do this first and exit the board, you win. Each tile has a two digit number. You roll the dice to move and you must move the full throw (if you can't, you forfeit the throw) and you are allowed to change direction once. After moving, you check the pips on both dice, and this will relate to two tiles. Example; You roll a 5 and a 3, this will relate to tile 53 or tile 35, your choice. If you roll doubles, only one tile will be available. The tile you choose is picked up and placed somewhere else. It can be anyway round and it must be adjacent to an existing tile.There are special tiles in the game, for example, the Start tile or The Misty Mists tile.

97383.name: The Impossible Test
97383.description:
The game that started it all. The original game in The Impossible Test series and over 9,000,000 downloads! Come play what everyone’s talking about, and play it all for FREE!

Source: The Publisher Website.

User Summary

In The Impossible Test you must try completing a series of tests, that - as the name of the game implies - are rather difficult.

97385.description:
Zuniq is an abstract game for two players, played in an 8x8 grid of evenly spaced dots.
Players take turns joining two horizontally or vertically adjacent dots by a segment. Eventually, closed zones will form. It’s irrelevant which player closes which zone; zones do not belong to any player.

There are only two restrictions:
- Once closed, zones are out of bounds for the players. They cannot move in its interior anymore.
- There can never be zones of the same size.
Zuniq’s goal is simple: to be the last player able to move. The player who cannot make a move (either because there are none possible or because it would make a zone with repeated size) is the loser. Draws are impossible.
97385.name: Zuniq

97386.name: Buggy
97386.description: Simple race game with the objective of being first to win the Rally.The pieces are nice, small cars (the Buggies in the title).

97387.name: Europa im Jet
97387.description: Educational game for children. They fly across Europe and learn a little geography. The winner is the first player who has visited the airports and also answer a question about each city.

97390.name: Litho
97390.description:
Want to challenge yourself with an original and mind-bending puzzle game for your iPhone/iPod Touch, which you can play at your own pace? Then Litho is for you!

The objective in this game is to take each piece available from the right side of the screen and place it on the board, dragging and rotating the piece with your fingers as necessary. If the piece fits, it will snap into place when you lift your finger and the symbols will light up. To detach a piece from the board, double-tap it.

Once all pieces are placed correctly, the game is won. There is no time limit, but your first and best times will be recorded for bragging rights, as well as the number of pieces you placed correctly on the first try.

Think you are up to the challenge? Then step up, and give your best shot at solving all the puzzles in Litho! There are 50 of them, each with a different set of pieces, which should keep you occupied for quite some time!

Features
50 different puzzles for your amusement.
Clean, fluid and stylish graphics.
Original soundtrack
Resume from where you left off after quitting the game.

Source: The Developer Website.

97391.name: Astro Boy: Omega Factor

videogamehonor.30948: 2004 Spike Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee

97391.description:
From the rulebook:

In the future...

After losing his only son in a car accident, a genius scientist named Dr. Tenma created a robot in memory of his son.

This robot was a scientific wonder unlike any other robot that existed.

He had six super abilities including 100,000 horsepower strength, rocket-powered feet, and the Omega Factor, which allowed him to experience human emotions.

Throughout the world, large numbers of robots were created to assist humans, however, the human race soon became afraid of the robots' capabilities.

The people are now trying to destroy the robots, causing the robotic race to rebel.

Underneath it all, someone is plotting a scheme to create even more tension and ultimately bring war.

Astro, who embodies both humand robotic traits, stands as a bridge between the two races and will always fight to reunite these two factions.

Astro must use not only his super powers, but his human Omega Factor to bring peace to robots and humans.

97392.name: Bratz: All Out Card Game
97392.description:
There are two ways to win ALL OUT - EITHER be the first to get rid of all your cards, OR be the first to collect a set of ten cards with matching icons.

Players collect sets of 3-10 character cards with the same icon. In his turn player plays set in front of him face up or add card with a matching icon to any set already on the table.
Player may also play an event card.

Player who gets rid of all your cards or has a set of 10 matching cards on the table in front of him must shout "ALL OUT!!!". He is the winner.

97393.name: Mortal Kombat (2011)

videogamehonor.31898: 2010 Game Critics Best Fighting Game of the Year Nominee

97393.description:
Mortal Kombat (also known as Mortal Kombat 9) is a fighting game from the Mortal Kombat series. Developed by NetherRealm Studios, it is the ninth installment in the series and the first published exclusively under the Warner Bros. label. Mortal Kombat was released on April 19, 2011 in North America, and is scheduled a European release on April 21 on the PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360 systems.

The story begins after the events of Mortal Kombat: Armageddon, but then returns to the period in which the first three games - Mortal Kombat, Mortal Kombat II, and Mortal Kombat 3 - occur. Due to a plot twist (the character Raiden now having knowledge of the future), the events of this time are slightly altered.

Mortal Kombat includes 3D graphics, with gameplay solely on the 2D plane (2.5D). The developers have also stated that this is the first game in which they are making a conscious effort to create deeper gameplay for more dedicated players of the series and of fighting games in general. Mortal Kombat was officially announced on June 10, 2010, accompanied with a debut trailer showcasing the new presentation and new gameplay features.

There are 27 playable characters (including a hidden alternate form to an already existing character), two downloadable characters and one console exclusive character (Kratos of God of War fame for PS3) that are featured in the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Mortal Kombat (2011 video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

97394.name: Fuzzle Pop
97394.description:
Fuzzle Pop is a fun and cute color matching game for iPhone and iPod Touch.
Fuzzles keep raining everywhere and you'll have to stop them.
Match three fuzzles in the same color and they'll pop.

- Simple but challenging game
-Cute graphics and catchy music
-Random gameplay

Source: The Developer Website.

97395.name: Destination: Rain Forest
97395.description:
This is an educational game to help with speech and communication skills using a rain forest theme.

A Game of Syntax, Morphology, and Phonology.

Contents include:
- Rain forest gameboard
- 5 card decks
- 21 token cards
- 7 token boards
- 4 playing pieces

There are 2 versions included in the rules:
- 1: secure more token cards than any other player. You receive a token card when you land on the "Explore the rain forest" square and answer a question correctly.
- 2: be the first to secure the three specific tokens that correspond to the token board held by the player. You do this by landing on a desired space that matches a space on your token board and correctly answer a question.

97397.name: Ja, See? Express
97397.description:
Ja, See? Express is a free Print & Play game that is inspired by older, more traditional dice-rolling games, but distills the rules down into only the most critical and exciting elements. This allows for a quicker and easier game, while still retaining all of the edge-of-the-seat dice-rolling thrills that players love.

In turn, players roll five dice and may choose to keep their results, or re-roll any number of dice up to two additional times, while trying to make the highest point-scoring combination of die results. At the end of their turn, players record their score on the custom score pad, and play proceeds to the next player. Play continues in this manner until all players have filled their score sheet, or until one player has scored 50 points. The first player to 50 points is the winner.

This version of the ruleset also includes bonus rules for Ja, See? Express Express, the fastest and most exciting way to play Ja, See? Express yet devised.

A PDF file containing the rules and components is now available in the Files section.

97398.description:
Hank Powerman’s dream was to run the perfect golf resort. He’d just won the one million dollar lottery; problem is, he doesn’t know how to design one. That’s where you come in. Hank will hire you to design the world’s greatest golf course.

In this unique card game, players must build a golf course by buying holes, and amenities (IE Pro Shop, Pool area, etc.), then using your "Fore!" cards that you were dealt with in the beginning of the game, by constructing your course, laying down the cards on the table making sure the cart path connects with each other. Continue to lay the cards until you have all 18 holes on your course, but beware your opponents can sabotage your course with gophers and floods. Don't forget, you also need employees to help you run Hank's Resort to help you combat your opponent's disasters.

"Its a game that's Par for the Course!"
97398.name: Hank's Golf Resort

97400.name: Epées & Sorcellerie (Beta)
97400.description:
de l'introduction:
Epées & Sorcellerie est un jeu de rôle inspiré du tout premier d’entre eux, publié en 1974 par Dave Arneson et Gary Gygax. Ce n’est pas une traduction, loin de là, mais une adaptation en français d’un jeu qui n’a d’ailleurs jamais été publié dans cette langue. Les règles originales sont déroutantes de simplicité et d’imprécision, pour qui connaît les versions ultérieures. Il n’en existe aucune version véritablement canonique, seulement une relecture souvent passée au filtre de l’histoire du jeu de rôle, les souvenirs des plus anciens joueurs, ou les interprétations aussi multiples que judicieuses.

Les règles de 1974 s’appuyaient elles-mêmes sur un jeu de combat à figurines, Chainmail, dont est issue toute l’histoire du jeu de rôles. J’y ai eu, en essayant de mettre au point, plusieurs fois recours, au point de renoncer à l’usage du dé à vingt faces, le fameux d20, devenu iconique du jeu, au profit des 2d6 pour lesquels il avait été initialement conçu. C'est de là que viennent, notamment, les capacités particulières des classes de personnages et de certaines créatures, qui diffèrent de celles de jeux ultérieurs de la même famille.

from the introduction (user translation):
Epées & Sorcellerie is a role playing game inspired by the very first one published in 1974 by Dave Arneson and Gary Gygax. This is not a translation, far from it, but rather a french adaptation of a game that has never been published anywhere before in that language. The original rules are startlingly simple and vague to anyone familiar with the later versions. No truly canonical version exists, only a rereading often filtered down through the history of role-playing games, the memories of the oldest players, or their interpretations which are as numerous as they are judicious.

The 1974 rules were based on the tabletop miniatures wargame "Chainmail", the historical source of all role-playing. I returned to them several times in the course of design, to the point of renouncing the use of the 20-sided die, the famous d20, icon of gaming, in favour of 2d6, for which the system was originally designed. From the 2d6 design, in particular, came the special capabilities of the character classes and certain creatures, which differ from those of subsequent games in the same family.

97401.name: Advance the Colors
97401.description:
User summary:
Advance The Colors is the first widely-published set of 1:1 ratio rules to cover the American Civil War. The rules focus on simulating tactical and skirmish-level engagements between company or regimental-sized units with an ideal size limit of between 200-300 figures per side. Each miniature represents a single soldier or artillery piece and the rules provide for officer ranks, command and control, and campaign development of individual soldiers through heroic actions. The rules we're written primarly for 15mm miniatures but can easily be used with 5mm-25mm.

rpg.10189: For Gold & Glory: Old School Roleplaying

97404.name: For Gold & Glory: Advanced Fantasy Role Playing Game 2nd Edition (Beta & Preview)
97404.description:
Introduction:
For Gold & Glory is an Open Game License interpretation of Zeb Cook’s 2nd Edition. All material contained within is free for use, distribution, copying, and updating within the confines of the OGL. The rules remain mostly intact but the descriptions have changed for the sake of brevity, clarity, and ease of reference. For Gold & Glory gives role players a complete reference to 2nd Edition “core material” and allows publishers to release original or new material using 2nd Edition rules.

97405.name: A Giant Game Sheet of Star Wars
97405.description: An 87cm x 61cm board,featuring various routes across the galaxy, from The Rebel Alliance start area and ending at theImperial Starship Battle Station Death Star. Players roll dice to advance along one of the routes, taking detours where indicated. The first player to reach the Death Star wins the game. The publisher claims this is an official adaption of the Twentieth Century Fox Film.

97407.name: Pretty Little Mistakes
97407.description:
Back of book

There are hundreds of lives sown inside Pretty Little Mistakes, Heather McElhatton's singularly spectacular, breathtakingly unique novel that has more than 150 possible endings. You may end up in an opulent mansion or homeless down by the river; happily married with your own corporation or alone and pecked to death by ducks in London; a Zen master in Japan or morbidly obese in a trailer park.

Is it destiny or decision that controls our fate? You can't change your past and start over from scratch in real life—but in Pretty Little Mistakes, you can! But be warned, choose wisely.

97408.name: Roll Around
97408.description:
This is a handheld action/skill game. By tilting and rotating the tube, try to maneuver the ball around the inside track. It's tricky but FUN for the whole family! The perfect score is 23, achieved by moving the ball back and forth across the track 4 times.

Components:

Roll Around game unit,
two steel balls

97409.description:
Excerpted from the back of the book

Best of Nexus
The best of the classic NEXUS files, completely revised and updated for the Captain's Edition!

Featured Scenarios & Items: Complete rules for the ISC (including Order of Battle, Counters, and rules) published here for the first time! Federation & Empire tactic notes & combat missions. Scenarios: The Hydran Expedition and The Second Federation-Kzinti War.

Also includes: Klingon Battlecruisers (four previously unpublished SSDs); Tactics; and Academy (the Commander and his cadets discuss classic SFB strategy & maneuvers).
97409.name: Captain's Log #13

97410.description:
User Summary

Too Close to the Flame

Featured Scenarios: Kzintis battle Lyrans, but they are all 'Too Close to the Flame. Klingons trap a Federation Battlecruiser with Betrayal at Oxvind V. The Masters force captive starships to play the cruel game of PhaserTag. The ISC tries to stop a war, but Accursed are the Peacemakers. Face a deadly solitaire challenge in Spinner's Moon. Play in a 500-point Squadron Tournament!

Also Included: Various extras & updates for Federation & Empire; SFB Universe Timeline; Tactics; and Four New Tournament Ships w/ SSDs.
97410.name: Captain's Log #15

97411.description:
Excerpted from the back of the book

A Sense of Obligation

Featured Scenarios: Stop the Jindarians! Rescue hostages from Tholian space. Intercept a convoy! There's a Q-ship inside your convoy. Take a Federation Mauler into a Nest of Andromedan Vipers! Hunt down the Klingon mauler Siegebreaker. Tackle a new monster: the Mulakee. Rescue a Convoy from a zone where it's Hotter than Blazes. X-ships meet in a Slugfest.

Also included: The Frax (16 pages of new SSDs); Eight New Ships (8 additional SSDs); Index (of all elements in the SFB Universe); More Federation & Empire info; and more
97411.name: Captain's Log #16

97413.name: Karnov's Revenge
97413.description:
Fighter's History Dynamite, also titled Karnov's Revenge in certain markets, was released for the arcades March 17, 1994. Due to change of hardware to SNK's MVS platform, the control configuration was reduced from six attack buttons to just four (only light and heavy attacks are available this time). Likewise, the game was released for the Neo Geo home console, as well as the Neo Geo CD, on April 28, 1994.

A new gameplay feature is introduced in the form of "one-two attacks". When the player presses a heavy attack button while performing a light attack or blocking, the interval between light attacks is reduced, making combos easier to perform. While this feature is not mentioned on the instruction card, the final page of the home Neo-Geo version's manual mentions it, describing as the "one-two attack" system.

Source: Wikipedia, "Karnov's Revenge", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

97415.name: Ultratron
97415.description:
User Summary

Ultratron is a progretro game, heavily inspired by Robotron: 2084, but imbued with Puppy Games' visual style, as well as modern notions like buying upgrades. It is one of their first three games, each of which was their take on a classic arcade or arcade-style game.

97416.name: Titan Attacks

videogameversion.273422: PlayStation 3 / PlayStation 4 / PlayStation Vita PSN edition

97416.description:
User Summary

Titan Attacks is a progretro game, heavily inspired by Space Invaders, but imbued with Puppy Games' visual style, as well as modern notions like buying upgrades, and boss levels. It is one of their first three games, each of which was their take on a classic arcade or arcade-style game.

97417.name: Droid Assault
97417.description:
User Summary

Droid Assault is a progretro game, heavily inspired by Paradroid, but imbued with Puppy Games' visual style. It is one of their first three games, each of which was their take on a classic arcade or arcade-style game.

97419.name: Coffee Talk
97419.description:
The Joy of Conversation Game

Turn over a “Topic Card” and then everyone has 45 seconds to write down whatever they can think of about in relation to the topic; topics range from New York City to Jay Leno to Google to Las Vegas. When time is up, players move their coffee beans up their respective containers (boards) based on the number of original ideas they had. To change a topic: “Cream it” and move on. To have the other players to accept your offbeat answers: Sweeten them up with a “Sugar Packet”... and you score.

Contents: 300 topics, 10 Instant Coffee Cards, 12 Sugar Packets, 12 Creamer Packets, 6 Coffee Beans, 6 Individual Coffee Cup Scoring Boards, 6 Score Pads and a 45 second Sand Timer.

boardgamehonor.21239: 2012 NZGA Game of the Year Winner

97420.name: Gumption

16780.name: HOD Business at Ormiston Senior College

97420.description:
The game board shows the economic resources of eight iconic kiwi organizations. Each player is in a race to own these resources. To win, a player needs to own all the resources (natural, human and capital) of two organizations. The first player to do this is the winner.

Players gain resources by either landing on an unowned resource and buying it from the bank or by trading with other players. The enterprising nature of Gumption is encouraged by deal-breaking squares on the game board and by risk cards. The playing pieces are familiar New Zealand icons which players use to move around the game board.

The game comes with a booklet that highlights each of the organizations depicted on the board.

Each denomination of the money used in Gumption profiles an invention that has started a New Zealand business.

There are three different kinds of cards in the game:

Risk Cards
Players take a Risk card and follow its instructions. Many Risk Cards can be traded with other players.

Resource Cards
Every resource shown on the Game Board has an associated resource card. This card shows the income that is payable when another player lands on the resource. It also shows the income payable if all three resources are owned and if the player has Future Technology. The resource cards can be traded with anyone except the bank.

Future Technology Cards
Players can invest in research and development and buy Future Technology, which will increase their income. This is done once players own all the resources of one organisation. There are Risk Cards that allow players to buy Future Technology without first owning all three resources.

97421.name: The Slippery Slope
97421.description:
The Slippery Slope is a board game designed to help players open up and deal with their emotions and feelings that are associated with the grief they feel when separated, going through a divorce or living through the aftermath of a single parent family.

Each player selects either a frog, race car or person, and starts moving down the slope. The slope is labeled for the stages you go through – Denial, Bargaining, Depression, Forgiveness, and Acceptance.

Each player receives one Grace Card at the beginning of the game. As each player rolls the die they will move 1, 2,or 3 spaces. As they move ahead they will have to either select an Action Card (a question designed to ask – What would you do…) or a Feelings Card (a question designed to ask – How would you feel…) Every now and then they may land on a miss a turn or move ahead or behind space. Depending on their roll, they may also acquire additional Grace Cards. The Grace Cards can be used at any time if they select a question they may choose to pass on. First one to reach Acceptance wins the game.

97422.name: The Mysterious Old Church
97422.description:
Publisher Blurb

Secret passages, hidden doors, mysterious strangers... what will the Ringers discover in the abandoned building? It's up to you!

97423.name: The Smithsonian Connection
97423.description:
Publisher Blurb

Trapped in the museum at night, the Ringers discover a nest of spies and a sinister plot. How will they get out? It's up to you!

97424.name: The Underground Railroad
97424.description:
Publisher Blurb

Under the old church, the Ringers find a hidden tunnel... What amazing secrets will they discover? It's up to you!

97425.name: 'Inventus-Patentus'
97425.description:
A "roll a die and move" round a track game where one buys/charges royalties on patents rather than streets in the Monopoly manner when players land on these squares. Having adjacent sets of patents enables enhanced royalties to be charged.
There is an added quiz element whereby when a play lands on an un-owned square, they may obtain the property for free if they can answer a question of the "Who invented ...." form.

97426.name: Futab
97426.description:
FUTAB is definitely a chess game. A game that will make you feel on the court, with all occurrences of a real game. You can experience the thrill of putting a scoring pass, connecting a center head, rally the contrary in their own area or win with a goal on the hour. I can define a tactical game and beat your rival.

FUTAB is a simulator of a soccer match. The objective is to defeat the opposing player throws the ball into the arch rival advancing through a series of boxes. To play you only need two dice and a "ball" (tab, coin, button, etc).

The board has represented the movements and plays more common in football and, through the roll of the dice and a good choice for best play, you can move forward on the grid court to reach the arch rival. The game is played to 90 dice throws.



FUTAB es definitivamente el ajedrez del fútbol. Un juego que te hará sentir dentro de la cancha, con todas las incidencias de un auténtico partido. Viví la adrenalina de meter un pase gol, conectar un centro de cabeza, pelotear al contrario en su propia área ó ganar con un gol sobre la hora. Definí una táctica de juego y vencé a tu rival.

FUTAB es un simulador de un partido de fútbol. El objetivo del mismo es vencer al jugador contrario introduciendo la pelota en el arco rival avanzando a través de una serie de casilleros. Para jugarlo solo se necesitan dos dados y una "pelota" (ficha, botón, etc).

El tablero tiene representados los movimientos y las jugadas más comunes en los partidos de fútbol y, a través del lanzamiento del dado y una buena elección de la jugada más conveniente, se puede ir avanzando en la cancha cuadriculada hasta alcanzar el arco rival. La partida se juega a 90 lanzamientos de dado.

97427.name: The Church of the Damned
97427.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Investigating corruption within the Ecclesiarchy itself is as delicate as it is dangerous, but when an influential leader is suspected of heresy, you and your fellow Acolytes will uncover an ever-deepening conspiracy that could spell the end of the entire Calixis Sector...

The Church of the Damned is the second adventure in The Apostasy Gambit, a Dark Heresy campaign that takes a cell of Acolytes from investigating the tragic history of a warped Cathedral to crusading against a conspiracy within one of the Imperium’s most vaunted organisations. While The Church of the Damned continues the events started in The Black Sepulchre, it also includes starting points to be played on its own or as part of your own campaign.

Suitable for players of all levels. A copy of the Dark Heresy Core Rulebook is needed to use this supplement.

97428.name: Yrrr' it!
97428.description:
Two classic games - Hot Potato and Tag - are rolled into one with the talking musical disc!

Yrrr' It! is the fun new game that will have the whole neighborhood hopping, skipping and rolling around with excitement! Music starts to begin "Hot Potato" as the disc is passed from player to player. If you are the last player to touch the disc before the buzzer then... Yrrr' It! To avoid getting tagged, all other players must jump, hop, skip, and even somersault away as commands are spoken from the talking disc. Careful, you'll never know what the talking disc will say or how much time you have before the buzzer sounds in this wildly hilarious game where the winner is truly up in the air!

97429.name: Rune Factory 3: A Fantasy Harvest Moon
97429.description:
Rune Factory 3 is a simulation/role-playing video game for the Nintendo DS and was developed by Neverland Co. It was released by Marvelous Entertainment in Japan and Natsume in North America. It is the third Rune Factory game released on DS, and the fourth in the Rune Factory series.

Source: Wikipedia, "Rune Factory 3", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

97430.name: Mr. Robot and His Robot Factory
97430.description:
User Summary
It is a simple side to side platform game where the player is controlling a robot trying to pick up all "pills" throughout the factory.
Player has 4 life (robots) to his disposal.
Life is lost if:
- Robot touches small fire beings
- Robot falls from too much height
- Energy runs out

There are temporarily invulnerability shields which can be picked which have offensive use as well (killing fire beings)

There are total of 22 official levels with level editor built into game.

97431.name: Harvest Moon DS: Grand Bazaar
97431.description:
Harvest Moon DS: Grand Bazaar is a farming/simulation video game released for the handheld Nintendo DS. It was developed and released in Japan by Marvelous Entertainment, and it was released on North America by Natsume. New to the series is the Grand Bazaar: each week the player can sell produce and other goods at market, where the aim is to make the most profit out of all the stalls.

Source: Wikipedia, "Harvest Moon DS: Grand Bazaar", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

97432.description:
Legend tells of the daring exploits and relentless greed of The Phoenix Syndicate, which rose to power and created a galactic regime – but the old order has lost its fire and become bogged down with the affairs of the masses. It is time for a new syndicate to rise from the ashes of the old...and make a tidy profit along the way.

The Phoenix Syndicate is a game about building a network of agents on planets spread across the galaxy. Every time you play, a new galaxy is created by randomly arranging the galactic hexes. You will claim contracts over the course of play, each specifying planets you may want to bring into your network. The better you can fulfill these contracts, the more lucrative the deal is and the more credits you will gain. Connecting planets to your network will require resources, which, of course, you "acquire" from the planets where you already have agents.
97432.name: The Phoenix Syndicate

97433.description:
From 1745 to 1747, during the War of Austrian Succession, Maurice de Saxe won three great victories against the Allied Army known as the "Pragmatic Army".

On May 11, 1745, at Fontenoy, after a brilliant maneuver, he drives the British-Dutch army, commanded by Cumberland, to confront him on the terrain of his choosing. Following a furious fighting where the French army, under the eyes of the King Louis XV, struggles but does not fall, the Pragmatic army retreats, leaving behind thousands of fallen men.

On October 11, 1746, at Rocoux, on the uplands of Liège, he defeats the allied army led by Austrian commander Charles Alexandre de Lorraine.

Finally, on July 2 1747, at the battle of Lauffeld near Maastricht, the French army attacks and is victorious from a position diametrically opposed to that of Fontenoy. Following fierce fighting around the village of Lauffeld, the Allied Army, once again commanded by Cumberland, owes salvation to the sacrifice of the British cavalry.

Les victoires du Maréchal de Saxe (Marshal de Saxe's victories) allows players to replay in an evening the Battles of Fontenoy and Lauffeld.

The game features the 5th entry in Vae Victis Wargames Collection and includes:
- 59x40 cm map (printed on both sides)
- 216 double-sided die-cut counters
- a rule and scenarios booklet
- a player-aid card in color

Complexity : 5/9

Bilingual Rules and Charts (English/French).
97433.name: Les victoires du Maréchal de Saxe: Fontenoy 1745 – Lauffeld 1747

97434.name: Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland
97434.description:
Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland is an action role-playing game developed by Vanpool and published by Nintendo for Nintendo DS. It stars Tingle, a minor character who has appeared in several games from the Legend of Zelda series.

Source: Wikipedia, "Freshly-Picked Tingle's Rosy Rupeeland", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

97435.name: Mushroom Alley
97435.description:
User Summary
This is a simple fixed top-down shooter game. It is a clone of more famous Centipede game.
Player shoots insects who invaded his garden and each hit turns one insect into mushrooms. There are few other wandering enemies as well, such as spiders, flying wasps etc.
Life is lost when:
- insects get to the bottom of the screen
- other enemies touches player

97436.name: Mr. Mephisto
97436.description:
Mr Mephisto is an one-page action arcade where player tries pass through all levels in hell-like realm. It is achieved by reaching the top gates, avoiding imps, ghosts, skulls, demons and other hell spawns.

Release for C64 has been done by Euro-Byte

User Summary

97437.name: The Muncher
97437.description:
Source: User summary

This is a side-scrolling action game where player is put in the role of big dinosaur. The main purpose is to wreak havoc around the city. This is done using several different moves - bite, stomp, tail lash, fire ball etc.
Beside innocent civilians there is a contingent of armed forces present - soldiers, tanks, helicopters etc.
When player runs out of energy the game is over, however there is a possibility of replenishing it by eating city inhabitants.

97438.name: Doodle Hex
97438.description:
User Summary

Doodle Hex, released on Nintendo DS, is a fighting game where players trace 'hexes' to cast them at their opponent. With a variety of hexes that have different functions such as dealing damage, shielding, and healing health, as well as different speeds and characteristics of each hex, Doodle Hex tests both quick thinking and accurate 'doodling'.

97439.name: Slap-Shot Hockey
97439.description: Players try to slap the puck into the opponent's goal with his stick in the hockey-board.

97440.name: Match Point Tennis
97440.description: Cadaco Match Point Tennis takes the Cadaco Bas-Ket game and adds a twist - rackets. The two players volley back and forth over the net playing by the rules of tennis using the standard flipper mechanism. Each player also has a racket which he can use to block shots.

97441.name: Murder on the Mississippi
97441.description:
User summary

Murder on the Mississippi is single player investigation game.
Player is put into the role of Sir Charles and accompanied with his assistant Regis.
During their trip on "Delta Princess" there has been a murder which they are trying to solve.
There are dozen other characters on the boat and your task is to go around, investigate, interrogate, collect evidence and finally find the culprit.
Boat holds few surprises for Sir Charles as well...

97442.name: VI Sup
97442.description:
Very unusual board game from the late 70's. Each player is a mountaineer and must climb the Mont Blanc to win the game. However, the player has to earn experience points to get the skills to climb mountains, so there are 22 mountains to conquer. Each climb is harder than the previous one. You don'Ät have to climb them all, you can choose which to climb. You might, for example, climb Number One (Aiguille du Belvédère) successfully, and then try Number Four (Aiguille Purtscheller), and so on.

Each climb is illustrated for the player, with various points along the route when equipment (Alea) cards might be asked for, the more equipment you have, the better for you. And the Descent (Rappel) might cause you problems.

The board is very attractive, showing the mountain ranges. There is a curious box in the right hand corner, on which you place two tiny green frogs. These frogs move during the game and when they reach certain points on the track, the weather changes (Meteo). This weather change can be catastrophic. You might not to be able to get down a mountain you have climbed and a helicopter might be needed to get you off the mountain.

The game looks great with all the Climbs being illustrated in some detail. The playing pieces look good but are completely impractible. They are plastic Picks, in 6 colours. And they fall over far too easily. And not to forget, the two green frogs.

In my game there was a card asking me to buy their next game, which would be about skiing. However, I got no reply and I never did see a second game.

97443.name: Murder on the Zinderneuf
97443.description:
User Summary

The year is 1936. The player takes on the role of a famous detective who is traveling across the Atlantic in the world's most prestigious zeppelin - The Zinderneuf. A murder is committed during the trip and it is up to the player to solve the crime. However, in twelve hours the zeppelin will land and the killer will be able to vanish without a trace.

The game is played from a top-down viewpoint. Actions are selected via a small pop up menu at the top of the screen. The game length is fixed at 12 in-game hours.

The player can choose from a set of different detectives with varying personalities. The game also features different murderers and victims which makes it highly replayable.

97444.name: Wiener Stadtbahnspiel
97444.description:
Players must travel around the Austrian city of Vienna in a tram, All the points of arrival has facts about the stops along the route. A die is used for movement. Quiz questions need answering at some point and the correct answers are within the rules. The winner is the first player to complete his route and return home.

I only have a reproduction of this game and I have no idea when it was first made. My edition is from the 1980's but the original must be over a hundred years old.

97445.name: Molecule Man
97445.description:
Molecule Man is trapped in a radioactive maze and must reach the escape teleport before the radiation kills him.
The player controls the Molecule Man in his quest to escape. He must find the teleport and repair it using 16 circuit board pieces that are scattered around the maze. Bombs must be purchased to blow open inaccessible areas. Meanwhile the radiation is killing him and health pills must be purchased to prolong his life.

Coins can be found lying around. These must be collected and taken to dispensers to purchase bombs and pills.

There is also a time limit that must be beaten.
Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Molecule_Man_%28video_game%29,&...; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

97446.name: Advance Guardian Heroes
97446.description:
From the rulebook:

Previously, in Guardian Heroes...
