The world suffered under the bitter reign of Kanon, the black mage, and his powerful Magic Kingdom. But the evil sorcerer was not satisfied and hungered for the mighty Soul Sword--the blade containing the soul of the Legendary Undead Hero, savior of the world in ages past.

He ordered his men to seize the sword, which was closely guarded by four noble adventurers in hiding--Han, Randy, Ginjirou, and Nicole. When the black mage's Royal Red Knights caught up with the adventureers, the Knights' commander Cerena disobeyed Kanon's order and came to the hidden nobles' aid. Together they revived the Undead Hero and with his help, began a war against Kanon and his malicous forces. Soon they were joined by Valgar, prince of the Magic Kingdom and head of the Royal Black Knights, who had been betrayed by Kanon and sought revenge.

When Cerena, Valgar, and the four heroes were called up to the heavens at last, they discovered that their struggles was far from over.The battle was all part of a greater plan to create ultimate warriors. For the mighty heavens, the mortal world was merely a proving ground. To make matters worse, the Undead Hero gave up control of the Soul Sword and returned to eternal rest. Without him, the final battle against the heavens became nearly impossible. Hwne the gods asked the new heroes to become their servants as ultimate warriors, some refused, some accepted, and some escaped back to the earth.

A long time passed...

Now, in Advance Guardian Heroes, the immortal Zur appears from nowhere, enlisted the heroes as servants of the gods and reviving Kanon with his special skills. Zur orders the heroes' souls to be pulled out, paving the way for Kanon to rebuild his Magic Kingdom and bring the peaceful world back under his malevolent control.

The surviving royal soldiers form a resistance against Kanon, but their numbers are rapidly decimated by the powerful mage. In a last, despirate attempt, they summon the power of the Soul Sword and ask for help from the soul of a hero from the other world. But a soul cannot enter the world without a body to accept it, and so an unknown soldiers volunteers himself as the sacrifice.

Now, together with the Princess, the unknown soldier heads to once again take control of the Legendary Soul Sword. To become a Legend... and save the earth...

97447.name: Monster Munch
97447.description:
Guide 'Munchie' around the maze and help him to eat all the white dots. Watch out for the monsters. If they catch 'Munchie', one of his three lives is lost and the player is killed by a bolt of lightning. Turn the monsters blue by eating one of the flashing power pills. While they are blue, 'Munchie' can kill them and gain lots of bonus points. When the question mark appears, eat it for a mystery bonus. When all the dots are eaten, you start a new screen which has even more dangers then the last.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monster_Munch_%28C64_computer_g...; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

97448.name: Phantasy Star Collection
97448.description:
User Summary:

Explore the Algo Solar System, where space opera meets high fantasy! This RPG became a classic with this blending of genres with an excellent storyline. Collects Phantasy Star I, II, and III.

From the rulebook:

PHANTASY STAR I

The Story

Tie time: Space Century 342. The palce: Camineet on Palma, one of the three planets in the Algol Solar system located deep in the Andomeda galaxy. Under the democratic rule of King Lassic, life was good as he provided everything his people could want. Space Travel had been discovered 200 years beofre and deep space shuttles had allowed colonization of Motavia and Dezoris, the other worlds of the Algol Solar System.

But slowly, over time, things began to change. Dark priest of a new religion, never seen by any mortal, promised immortality to all who joined. You would live forever! King Lassic was getting old. The idea of living forever appealed to him so he became the first to join. Then, he... changed. The people began to suffer and horrible creatures and monsters began to stalk all three worlds. Lassic had become an evil tyrant.

But where there is evil there is always good. Lassic's Robotcops were ruthless, ferreting out the do-gooders that meant to unseat him. One of those do-gooders was Nero. Long ago, his father had disappeared trying to learn Lassic's evil secrets. And finally the Robotcops caught up with Nero as well. Before he died, he passed on his short sword and his quest to his sister, Alis. He also told her to find a brave fighter named Odin. Alis raised the sword to the sky and vowed that Nero's death would not be in vain!

PHANTASY STAR II

The Story

Somewhere drifting in space is the beautiful Algo Star System. Around the parent star, Algo, whirl its three children--Palm, Mota, and Dezo.

Among the planets, Mota's history is the most troubled. From far in her past comes the legend of Alis, the courageous young woman who fiercely found--and succeeded--in ridding Mota of the evil oppressor Lassic.

But now another tragedy oppresses Mota. This is one far worse than Lassic, being not a person, but an unknown evil! Everything is affected by it--the climate, the machinery, even nature! Strange vicious creatures infest the countrysides. They terrify and destroy! No longer does anyone venture outside a city--unless they don't want to return.

What happened to Mother Brain, the controlling entity of Mota? Why have things gone so wrong? Who is smart enough to solve the riddle? And who is brave enough to save the planet?

PHANTASY STAR III

The Story

Today's your big day. You're marrying Maia, the mysterious woman you found on the shores of your father's kingdom. But as you and Maia walk up the aisle, a winged dragon grabs your bride and disappears...

This is the tragic start of what seems to be a never-ending journey into a world of loathsome creatures and wicked souls. Live through three generations in this epic adventure and find out what lies behind the realm of terror. Only you determine which of the four endings you'll experience.

In the beginning you are Rhys. Gather information by talking to the people in Landen, where your father rules as king.

97449.name: Cima: The Enemy
97449.description:
From the rulebook:

Guardians of the Gates

Building dungeons, taking over land and feeding off human hope, the Cima have created a realm of desolation and despair. Some have chosen to fight this new danger by becoming "Gate Guardians"--those that protect the innocent from becoming ensnared in the Cima's dungeons. Ark and Ivy, two young Cima fighers, are new Gate Guardian recuits. While traveling with their mentor, Jester, and 14 others bound for a new frontier, the train is sucked without warning into a Cima Gate and everyone on the train becomes separated in the cavernous dungeons below. Ark and Ivy's first task is to find, protect and add these people to their fighting party as they are plunged into a mysterious and frightening new world.

97450.name: Konami Collector's Series: Arcade Advanced
97450.description:
User Summary:

Includes Frogger, Gyruss, Time Pilot, Rush 'n Attack, Scramble, and Yie Ar Kung Fu. Improves the graphics of the originals, adds levels, modifies the difficulty, and adds multiplayer link mode.

97451.description:
Nénufable is a wooden game for children (and adults).

It's a race between frogs where the goal is to be the first frog under the balcony of the princess to be kissed by her.

Players can move ahead, put a stone or waterlily to make a road, push opponent in the water or move the princess to another balcony.

But beware... there is a sorceress in the castle who randomnly move from balcony to balcony, and if you finish under her balcony she push you in the water, and you have to restart from the begining...
97451.name: Nénufable

97452.name: Bistourisq
97452.description:
Bistouris is a game of plastic surgery.
Each player is a patient AND a doctor.

The game takes place in two rounds.

First round, each player roll dice, move on the board and draw cards to create their own (and awful) bodies.
When the body of each player is done, the second round begin.

At the begining of the second round, each player draw a "perfect body" card to know what they need to change on their bodies.
Now players roll dice and move again on the board and try to reach on "surgery" squares to have surgery from other players... but beware... surgical procedures may fail and you end up with a body worse than before and you have twice as much work !!!
Other players bet on the result of the surgery and if it fail, the surgeon must explain what's went wrong.

The first player who manages to have a perfect body (as his "perfect body" card") is the winner

97453.name: Tabakitaba
97453.description:
Tabakitaba is an educational and fun game on tabacco.
A bit of monopoly, a hint of trivial pursuit, an inch of strategy game and some educational datas on tabacco.

One player play the tabacco industry and other players are citizens.

The goal for the tabacco industry is to convert up to citizens to smoking.
The goal for the citizens is to safeguard their health and stop smoking.

Players move on a board (the city) consting of several kind of squares (events, temptation, disease risks, tobaccological consultation) and a hex map (the rural) where citizens and tobacco industry can plant cereals or tobacco.

At the end, the player with the best health is the winner and the tobacco industry too if there are more smokers than non-smokers.

97454.name: Western
97454.description:
"The waltz of the dough ! The quest for loot!"

Western is a card game between Wanted and Cash n' Guns.

The goal is to be the first player to earn an amount of dough depending of the number of players (400.000 to 500.000 dough).

Each player begin the game with an amount of dough and some cards in hand.
There is also a bank with some money (or a money train).
Players use cards and a round die to attack each other, trying to stole some money (or lose some if the fail !), they can also use "dirty tricks" or other protection cards and sometimes fight for the money train.
The game ends when a player has 400.000 dough.

There is 108 cards in more than 20 kinds.

Rules in french can be found on the editor website (english and other languages are coming).

97455.name: Delving Deeper Boxed Set
97455.description:
Website blurb:

Delving Deeper RPG closely emulates the rules of the earliest version of the world’s most popular roleplaying game. Go back to a time when every weapon did d6 damage, clerics could cast no spell at first level, only fighters could use magic swords, and if you wanted a locked door opened you had to bash the thing in! It is difficult to imagine in a world where multiple, weighty tomes comprise the rules; but the these three small books contain all you need to build a campaign that can span decades of real time! If you’re tired of trying to find the rule for determining whether your fighter is left-handed and is able to swim and just want to kill some goblins, have we got a game for you!

But wait, there’s more! While Delving Deeper is a solid, rule set that closely emulates the rules of the earliest version of Original Edition, it also has a toolbox aspect to it as well. Running throughout the game are two separate tracks of options – little tweaks to the rules that help DD also emulate the rules of the First Basic Edition (“Basic Track”) and the rules of the Third Print Edition of a modern rpg inspired by Original Edition (“Modern Track”).

Delving Deeper RPG will be released directly from Brave Halfling Publishing as a digest boxed set of booklets, dice, character sheets, etc. the first week of April and in your local game store in May. We will be supporting Delving Deeper RPG with modules, supplements and campaigns. A free trademark license will also be available for third party publishers.

This Boxed Set Contains everything you need to play:
• Forging a Hero (Player's Guide)
• Codex of the Divine and the Arcane (Spells)
• Index of the Fiendish and Malign (Monsters)
• Vault of Treasures (Treasure & Magic Items)
• Delving Deeper and Blazing New Trails (Referee's Guide)
• Robert Conley’s, Blackmarsh Campaign Setting
• A pad of 25 digest character sheets.

122652.name: Battle of 4 Armies Expansion Kit: The Battle is Joined

97456.description:
From designer Nathan Hansen comes a quick paced, deep decision rich, abstract strategy BattlessonTM game, Battle of 4 Armies. Match your skills against up to three opponents, for your goal is the Crown of Chip! Through the judicious use of unit placement and maneuver, you struggle to capture opposing units to knock them out of play, or hold the majority of named spaces on the board. With pressure for the center of the map and maneuver around its edges, players have myriad ways to approach every turn of this absorbing game. Make your move in the Battle of 4 Armies!

Game Data:

Complexity: 1.5 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 2 on a 9 scale
Scale: Each unit represents a single troop of fantasy warriors.

Game Components:

• One 8.5” x 11” color game map
• One 2-page, color instructions sheet
• One BattlessonTM sheet
• 20 color, die-cut 1” mounted game pieces
97456.name: Battle of 4 Armies

97457.name: Pathologic (2006)
97457.description:
The game is about three people who are known mostly by their nicknames. Two men Bachelor (Бакалавр) and Haruspex (Гаруспик), and a girl nicknamed Devotress (Самозванка). Each of whom tries to uncover the source of a strange lethal sickness that befalls a small town. Although you can play as each of them, there is only one storyline, which is seen from different points of view depending upon the chosen character. Some of the secrets can be uncovered only by the consecutive playing of each character. Every day you receive quests from NPCs and at exactly midnight of each day, the incomplete quests are erased from your notebook. Quests are divided into main missions (one per day, which decide if a major character will die), and side quests to complete to earn money and items.

On the edge of town, there is a great building named Polyhedron (Многогранник), an impossible geometric structure used as a fortress by children. On the opposite side, a great ominous mountain called the Abattoir, with the Apiary, an insane asylum, next to it. All districts and major buildings of the town are named after body parts and biology.

Source: Wikipedia, "Pathologic," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

97458.name: Read My Lips, Kid!
97458.description:
Read My Lips! version for younger people where they have 20 seconds to "lip" words and sayings for everyone else to guess. Words are from 6 categories: Person, Place, TV/movie, Thing, Music, Saying. Sometimes easy, sometimes not so easy.

Be the first player to correctly guess two words/sayings in all six categories.

97459.description:
Publisher Blurb:

There may be no one in the entire world whose skill with the bow rivals that of Daniella Meris. Not only is her aim unequaled, but her mastery of the Ki Domains and her control of energy allow her to face entire battalions alone.

Warrior - Light Empire - Level 45

Innate Abilities - Ranged Attack (16 inches), Advanced Deployment

Ripple in Water (Ki, Ranged Attack) - Distance (16 inches), Roll two dice and keep the highest result.

Chasing the Moon (Ki, Ranged Attack) - Distance (20 inches), If this attack causes damage, the target unit suffers Seal Lv2, Effect 15.

Shooting Star (Ki, Ranged Attack) - Distance (16 inches), +1 Attack. When this attack hits the target, all units within 2 inches of the target character also suffer the Attack

Divine Flames (Ki, Ranged Attack) - Distance (16 inches), +3 Attack. When this attack hits the target, all units within 3 inches of the target character also suffer the attack.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.
97459.name: Anima Tactics: Danielle Meris

97460.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Master strategist and unrivaled warrior, at twenty-one years of age Yuri Olson is the youngest person in history to achieve the rank of Imperial General. Considered by all the right hand of the Warlord Elías Van Horsman by his own merits, Yuri is also the secret leader of field operations of the Hand of the Empress, the special corps of agents of Elisabetta Barbados.

Leader Warrior - Light Empire - Level 55

Innate Abilities - Critical Mastery, Initiative.

Unbreakable Will - If Yuri suffers Damage, he gains +1 to his Attack during the rest of the game.

King's Tower (Ki, Effect, Reactive) - Yuri or a friendly unit within his Control Zone gains +3 Defense against a specific Attack.

Queen's Round (Ki, Attack) - Roll two dice and keep the highest result. If the attack causes a Critical Hit, deal +5 to Damage.

Tactical Mastery (Special, Effect, Reactive) - This ability may be used at the end of the Recovery Phase. All friendly units with Line of Sight to Yuri recover an additional Action Point.

Limit: Once per game.

War Cry (Special, Effect) - When War Cry is used, friendly units within Yuri's Control Zone receive +1 Attack and +1 Damage until the end of the Turn and lose any negative state counters. The bonus is kept even if the units leave Yuri's Control Zone.

Limit: Once per game.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.
97460.name: Anima Tactics: Yuri Olson

97461.name: High Stakes Party Football
97461.description:
Each player picks a game piece and place it on its image on the board. High roll of dice determines who goes first.
Set up Freddie, decide whether to play for real cash or play stuff, pace your ante. Turn on TV football game - It's party time!

Object of the Game: You are betting on a football game so if you win the money, ah...you win! Game play is determined by the TV game. Make first downs and win the Freddie Pot in the middle of the field. Make it to the end or be the farthest along the board or game's end to win the big bucks in the Pom Pot in the end zone! Game Contents: 8 playing pieces and stands, Freddie Football and stand, pair of dice, play money, game board and rules sheet

Components:

1 game board.
8 playing pieces and stands.
Freddie Football with stand.
Pair of dice.
Play money (80 1s, 5s and 10s).
Rules sheet.

97462.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The 3D Castles Expansion Set provides you with additional modular card stock castle pieces to allow you to customize the shape and size of your Grunt castle. It also provides an additional 3D city and siege towers, ballisti, and more.
97462.name: Grunt Deluxe: Castles Expansion Set

97463.name: Dungeon Master's Token Set: Scales Expansion
97463.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Created in cooperation with Wizards of the Coast, these sets contain more of the fantastic tokens and markers that a DM needs to manage combats and track the status of a dungeon's denizens as they battle intrepid adventurers! Each set contains a new token, the Burst Origin, which can be used to note from where a burst area attack or spell originates. Also featured are more tokens denoting the combat conditions that affect heroes and the monsters they battle, including 24 scale-type tokens in the set as well as 5 more Bloodied tokens, handy for battles with many combatants. The unique shape of the scale tokens allows you to use them multiple ways in combat, with the curved top allowing the tokens to nest against the base of miniatures, or to be placed on corresponding character sheets and monster cards.Along with Burst Origin token, the Scales Expansion set contains 30 tokens in all.

97464.name: Dungeon Master's Token Set: Scroll Expansion
97464.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Scrolls Expansion set contains more of the clever blank scroll tokens that allow you, with the use of a wet-erase marker, to track unique conditions and ongoing damage in your combats. There are 9 Ongoing Damage scrolls and 9 Status scrolls, each shaped so that they can rest against the base of miniatures, or they may be placed on corresponding character sheets and monster cards. The set also contains 2 different colored sets of Marked tokens for those combatants that have focused on their targets. Rounding out the set are 5 more Bloodied tokens and the new Burst Origin token for a total of 30 tokens!

97465.name: Dark Sun Desert Map
97465.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Gale Force Nine’s Official DUNGEONS & DRAGONS Game Mats are high-quality single-sided vinyl surfaces that are ideal battle grids for staging encounters during your adventures! The mats lie flat for ease of play and are sold in a sturdy polycarbonate tube for easy storage and transport. The mats may be marked with WET-ERASE markers to temporarily alter terrain areas or make other notes about battlefield conditions during play. The Game Mats measure 20" x 30" and are marked with a 1" grid. All of GF9's Game Mats are based on artwork provided by Wizards of the Coast.

The deserts of Athas are cruel and unforgiving. The shifting dunes reveal lost treasures and swallow careless caravans. But these sands are not devoid of life, dangerous creatures and malicious raiders stalk the sands in search of their next victims. Rocky outcroppings dot these badlands, their shade providing a brief respite from the blazing sun. Dust sinks dot the land, a foolish traveler can be swallowed whole with one misstep.

The DARK SUN Desert mat is ideal for staging your encounters on the world of Athas or in any desert in any campaign world.

97466.name: Dark Sun Campaign Map
97466.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Gale Force Nine’s Official DUNGEONS & DRAGONS Campaign Maps are high-quality single-sided vinyl surfaces that are ideal for tracking the progress of your adventures during their campaigns! These maps lay flat for ease of play and are sold in sturdy polycarbonate tubes for easy storage and transport. The maps may be marked with WET-ERASE markers to temporarily record the paths your heroes travel, make notes about encounters and locations or the modify landscape to suit your own campaign. They also look great on the wall of your game room! The Campaign Maps measure 30" x 42". All of GF9's Campaign Maps are based on artwork provided by Wizards of the Coast.

"I live in a world of fire and sand. The crimson sun scorches the life from anything that crawls or flies, and storms of sand scour the foliage from the barren ground. This is a land of blood and dust, where tribes of feral elves sweep out of the salt plains to plunder lonely caravans, mysterious singing winds call travelers to slow suffocation in the Sea of Silt, and selfish kings squander their subject’s lives building gaudy palaces and garish tombs. This bleak wasteland is Athas, and it is my home." From The Wanderer's Journal

This campaign map details the world of Athas, the setting for DUNGEONS & DRAGONS campaigns in DARK SUN. Packed with details, this map is a great way to chart your adventures across this dangerous and desolate landscape.

97467.name: City of Tyr Campaign Map
97467.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Gale Force Nine’s Official DUNGEONS & DRAGONS Campaign Maps are high-quality single-sided vinyl surfaces that are ideal for tracking the progress of your adventures during their campaigns! These maps lay flat for ease of play and are sold in sturdy polycarbonate tubes for easy storage and transport. The maps may be marked with WET-ERASE markers to temporarily record the paths your heroes travel, make notes about encounters and locations or the modify landscape to suit your own campaign. They also look great on the wall of your game room! The Campaign Maps measure 30" x 42". All of GF9's Campaign Maps are based on artwork provided by Wizards of the Coast.

While most of the great city-states of Athas are ruled by cruel sorcerer-kings, the free city of Tyr stands apart. The intrigues of Tyr attract many an adventurer looking for fame and glory or to simply survive in the harsh world of DARK SUN.

This campaign map of the City of Tyr shows the various districts and landmarks of the great city. Players can keep track of their adventures in the city while DM’s can note locations of NPCs, shops, taverns, inns and other important location in their campaigns.

97468.name: Adventure Maps
97468.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Gaming Paper Adventures Maps can be used to build thousands of unique dungeons in practically any shape or configuration. The Mega Dungeon 1 set features:

-100 unique, highly detailed dungeon geomorphs created by fantasy cartographer extraordinaire, Christopher West. These can be arranged in hundreds of different patterns!
-Two-sided design. One side shows unfurnished dungeon rooms for you to fill. The other side has furnished rooms imagined and rendered by Christopher West himself.
-Permission to photocopy the tiles for personal use
-Together, all one hundred sheets for a massive single mega-dungeon 10 sheets tall by 10 sheets wide. Nearly 65 square feet of playing surface.

97469.name: Blokus Junior
97469.description: Blokus Junior is the perfect way to teach kids as young as 5 years-old the art of strategy. Similar to Blokus, the fastest growing strategy brand, the object of Blokus Junior is to get as many pieces on the board as possibly by placing each piece corner to corner. Made with younger hands in mind, Blokus Junior has less complicated pieces, a bigger board, and 10 mini-games to help kids learn how to play the game. Includes 48 pieces, paper templates, game board and instructions.

97470.name: Jarmial
97470.description:
Jarmial is a fantasy card game close to korsar in the mechanic.

Players fights for realms of 5 colors trying to collect a set of 4 realms of the same color or 5 realms of the 5 colors

Players use creatures of different strengths and colors and spells to win the realms.
When someone plays a color on a realm, other players need to use another color to fight on it.
When a player collects a set of 4 realms of a kind or 5 realms of the 5 colors, the round ends, then players earn points depending of what they have collected and they start anorther round.

After some rounds (determined at the beginning of the game) the winner is the player with most points.

97471.name: Sesquipedalian
97471.description:
Sesquipedalian is a word game, intended primarily as an vocab-building game for kids. It shares mechanics with party games like Cranium and Balderdash. Players move through the board by rolling a die, and complete color coded actions corresponding to their space on the board. Actions include:

- illustrating a word
- acting out a word
- guessing the definition of a word
- making up definitions of a word for other players to guess
- guessing the correct category of a word (such as "astonishing actions")

The game comes with a small dictionary, with a focus on rare, multisyllabic and/or unusual-sounding words. Also included are rules for other simple paper-and-pencil games that can be played using the dictionary, including Hangman, Ghost, and Word Squares.

97473.name: 18NAC
97473.description: 18NAC is an 18xx game that includes railroads across the North American Continent. 18NAC is played on a 55" by 34" map depicting northern Mexico, southern Canada, and the continental United States. The game includes 29 U.S. railroads, 14 in the East and 15 in the West, as well as 5 Mexican companies and the Canadian Pacific. The game includes several mechanics that are unique to the 18xx genre, including a system of subsidiaries (rather than privates) that allow players to customize their railroads, an anonymous auction, and land grant companies.

97475.name: The Mind Unbound
97475.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Mind is the key to unlock your shackles. Greed has left half a world bleeding and broken beneath the weight of poverty, conflict, and slavery. Only we can lead the oppressed beyond the horrors of the Corporate age. Trust in us, and we will set you free.

The Mind is the weapon to rout your enemies. Fear has left our rivals struggling to comprehend the power we command, scrambling to blunt it. Only we can shepherd the defenceless in a world full of predators. Trust in us, and we will protect you.

The Mind is the tool to change your world. War has left society on the brink of the abyss, held in a fragile balance of bitter rivals and capricious powers. Only we can guide the innocent through a second darkness and back into light. Trust in us, and we will bring you to a new age of peace... no matter the cost.

Unbound, the Mind grants strength and understanding beyond petty morals or the judgements of a fallen civilisation; the strength to do what must be done for the greater good.

Welcome, Agent, to the Comoros Corporation.

Features
- New Trainings, Licenses and Playable Sects
- Expanded Substandard Equipment
- In depth information about Comoros policy, management and structure
- A wealth of new telepathic options including four new Skills.
- Details on the CEO, Shadow CEO and the mysterious Under Council.
- Rules for Dreamhacking - enter the minds of your enemies.
- Details of major rebel and insurrectionist groups.
- New locations, NPCs and equipment.
- Is this great Corporation as benevolent as it appears? All is revealed.

97476.name: Cathay: The Five Kingdoms Player's Guide
97476.description:
Publisher Blurb:

For centuries, the lands of the west have been enthralled by tales about the mystical province of Cathay. Far to the East, this mysterious place has always been a symbol of intrigue and wonder. Now, the door to the East is open. From the lightning-born storm children, to the renowned Xan monks, Cathay’s secrets can finally be explored by those brave enough to venture into this troubled, war-torn realm.

The Cathay: The Five Kingdoms Player’s Guide is a sourcebook for Earthdawn Third Edition, containing everything a player needs for adventuring the Five Kingdoms of Cathay - new Namegiver races, Disciplines, talents, spells, and much more! Requires use of the Earthdawn Player’s and Gamemaster’s Guides.

97477.name: RuneQuest II Compendium Volume 1
97477.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This first volume of the RuneQuest Compendiums collates all the most popular articles that have appeared in Signs & Portents over the years, and presents them for the tabletop! Inside you will find new magicks, in-depth treatises on the Aldryami, new monsters, shapeshifting, Gloranthan characters - and rules for getting drunk!

Useable with all RuneQuest II-based settings.

97478.name: Cities of the Young Kingdoms 1: The South
97478.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Alorasaz: frozen city of fur trappers, loggers and miners, deep in Lormyr\'s wintery southlands. A peaceful place on the surface, but beneath lurk tensions and fears as two competing families struggle to control Alorasaz\'s wealth. And what of Castle Kaneloon, standing on the very edge of the world? Does the Lady Myshella not exert an influence over sleepy Alorasaz?

Raschil: the bustling, civilised port city of Filkhar, a cosmopolitan place where many nations rub shoulders in the countless taverns and inns. But a city with its own secrets too: why, for instance, has the Queen not been seen for months when, once, she was society\'s doyenne?

Ryfel: built from black granite and mud-brick on Pikarayd\'s wild and treacherous northern coast: a city of pirates and reavers, and a meeting place for the barbaric clans of the interior. Ryfel attracts the proponents of Chaos and Disorder; sorcerers, murderers and dark cultists; thieves, fugitives and feuding clansmen. Pan Tang holds court here; but are the Pikaraydian chieftains as enthralled as Pan Tang believes them to be?

Volume One of \'Cities of the Young Kingdoms\' explores three, very different cities of the Young Kingdoms\' southern continent. Each city is described in detail with maps, locations, personalities, game statistics and dozens of adventure hooks. The cities can be used as standalone backdrops for Elric of Melnibone games, bases for adventurers, or as part of the mini-campaign that threads between them and joins them together.

Welcome to the southern lands...

97479.name: History of War: Axis Troops
97479.description:
Publisher Blurb:

History of War (HoW) presents the Second World War from the tactical point of view of units. Retaliatory weapons, atomic bombs or personal names like those of generals are deliberately excluded from the game.

The goal of the game is a conquest of land cards until 15 win points are accumulated. This is accomplished by bringing together units from all three arenas of the war: land, sea, and air.

The Axis starter deck contains 55 cards and a rulesheet. The deck is fully playable. Each player needs their own deck to play.

97480.name: Armageddon Unlimited
97480.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Demons and Deevils are fighting for dominance of the Earth, and if they can’t win, nobody can have it. They’ll destroy the planet.

Armageddon Unlimited is the ultimate good vs evil setting and adventure. The fate of the world hangs in the balance and only you can stop its destruction.

Armageddon Unlimited is more than an epic, world-saving adventure, it is also a sourcebook jam-packed with new powers, magic, weapons and Power Categories that can be incorporated into any Heroes Unlimited campaign.

Highlights include:

7 new Minor and 14 Major Super Abilities.

Deevil and Demon magical Chaos Weapons.

Enchanted Weapons of Order.

Demon Hunter Power Category and abilities, ‘nuff said.

Crusader of Light Power Category and abilities allow you to play a Champion of Light.

Heroic Hellion Power Category and abilities allow you to play a "reformed demon."

Magically Bestowed Variant Power Categories and abilities let you wield weapons that empower good and destroy evil.

Demonic monster creation table.

More than a dozen NPC villains.

Arcane orders, secret societies, and magic guilds.

The Chaos Generator and the threat of Armageddon.

A menagerie of evil villains, people and places.

The Armageddon scenario and adventure ideas.

97481.name: GameMastery Map Pack: Dungeon Sites
97481.description:
Publisher Blurb:

ENDLESS DUNGEONS TO DELVE!

You can’t keep adventurers out of the dungeon. Whether the ruins of forgotten empires or the fortresses of villainous kings, heroes risk it all to claim fame and fortune amid forsaken labyrinths. But no Game Master wants to spend time drawing every darkened hallway and suspicious corridor. Fortunately, with Paizo Publishing’s latest GameMastery Map Pack, you don’t have to! Inside, you’ll find 18 captivating 5" × 8" specially coated map tiles, allowing you to use wet erase and dry erase markers, then remove ink with ease!

This set includes:
Hidden Library
Ruined Hall
Throne Room
Trapped Chamber
Treasure Room
Game Masters shouldn’t waste their time sketching maps every time an adventure calls for a deadly ruin. With GameMastery Map Pack: Dungeon Sites, you’ll be ready next time your players go dungeon crawling!

Good GMs can never have too many maps at their disposal, and Paizo’s GameMastery Map Packs provide high-quality gridded maps for use with both RPGs and miniatures games.

97482.name: New France
97482.description:
Publisher Blurb:

France and England have always been rivals.

As it has always been in Europe, so it is in America. From Quebec to the Great Lakes and the Mississippi Delta, New France offers a constant challenge to the British colonies. French troops garrison Quebec and Montreal. French forts dot the interior. French Louisiana - in theory, at least - extends from the Appalachians to the Rocky Mountains.

Welcome to New France

In this book you will find a complete description of New France, with information on its political structure, society, and major settlements. There are notes on making French colonial Heroes, including the famous
coureurs des bois - the explorers, trappers, and traders who did much to open up the interior to France. Campaign settings on offer include the
"Golden Age" of French power, the French and Indian War which created British Canada, and the Revolutionary War.

Allons-y! Pour la France - and let us teach these British that they do not own the New World!

97483.name: Bridal Shower Pictionary
97483.description:
In Bridal Shower Pictionary game each team chooses a Picturist for the first round. A Picturist is the person who will sketch for their team. One Pictionary card is selected out of the bowl. Each Picturist looks at the bridal shower theme word and begin sketching for their team when time is started. Remember not to use letters of numbers in your sketch. The first team to guess the word correctly in one minute or less scores a point on the score card. The Picturist rotates for each team and play continues until one team has scored 10 points.

Game for 2 teams

97484.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 164 - Jun 2010)
97484.description:
Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine
Issue #164
June 2010

Mummy Dearest

Cover art by Brendon Fraim and Brian Fraim.

97485.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 163 - May 2010)

rpgissuearticle.87967: Back Room at the Games Pit

97485.description:
Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine
Issue #163
May 2010

Every Picture Tells a Story

Cover art by George Vrbanic and Jackie Vrbanic.

97486.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 162 - Apr 2010)

rpgissuearticle.87931: Back Room at the Games Pit

97486.description:
Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine
Issue #162
April 2010

SpaceHack 3000

Cover art by Caleb Wallace with colour by Empty Room Studios.

97487.name: Szarpane miasto
97487.description:
publisher's blurb:

Scenariusz "Szarpane Miasto" do gry Klanarchia liczy 56 stron. Znajdziecie w nim technoklanycki wymiar Klanarchii: mistyczną technologię, kultystów maszyn, postapokaliptyczną scenerię oraz jeden z najbardziej odjechanych powietrznych pościgów, jakie dotychczas rozegraliście!

and translation:

Scenario "Szarpane Miasto" for a Klanarchia game is 56 page long. In it you will find technoclanish view of Klanarchia: mistycal technology, cultists of the machines, postapocalyptic theme and one of the most entertaining chases you have ever played.

97488.name: My Realms (Heroic Tier)
97488.description:
From the front of the book:
A My Realms adventure is the DM’s chance to shape the fate of a group of characters. Are you up to the challenge? A Living Forgotten Realms adventure set in the DM’s imagination for characters of the Heroic tier (levels 1-10).

97489.name: My Realms (Paragon Tier)
97489.description:
From the front of the book:
A My Realms adventure is the DM’s chance to shape the fate of a group of characters. Are you up to the challenge? A Living Forgotten Realms adventure set in the DM’s imagination for characters of the Paragon tier (levels 11-20).

97490.name: Teletubbies Match & Stamp
97490.description:
With three different ways to play, the Teletubbies Match & Stamp game is both an activity kit and a game. It comes with 4 cans of different-colored Play-Doh; 12 Teletubbies stampers that fit nicely into their own sturdy holder; 6 Teletubbies cards, each with 4 different images; and 4 plastic trays, plus a wooden roller for rolling out the Play-Doh. Players match the pictures on the stampers to the pictures on their Teletubbies card. The corresponding Teletubbies images are then pressed into the Play-Doh with the stampers.

Just roll the dough, pick a stamper and make a picture.
In the beginners' game, the youngest fans will search for "lookalikes," matching stamper pictures with pictures on their cards. In the next two games, the stamper pictures are hidden: Pick a stamper - who's got matching picture?

Components:

12 Teletubbies Stampers
4 Cans of Playdoh
6 Teletubbies Cards
4 Plastic Trays
Stamper Holder
Wooden Roller

97493.name: Rosetta
97493.description:
Rosetta is a boardless tile-laying game with hex-tiles. Each tile (except 3 extra-tiles showing a rose) shows one of the numbers from 1 to 7. They are available in four player colours and 7 times as white. The white ones are the general supply, forming three stacks, so the three top tiles are available. Each player has the tiles of his own colour as a "personal supply".
Gameplay: On a player`s turn, he can choose either a white top tile or a tile from his personal supply and place it adjacent to any tile(s) already placed on the table. It is allowed to place any white tile adjacent to any other tile, but coloured tiles must not be adjacent to other coloured ones. Aim of the game is to create as many "perfect Rosettas" as possible: groups of seven tiles, with a tile of your colour as the centre and 6 white tiles with the other six numbers surrounding it, which is 10 points worth in the final score. If one or more tiles of 7 tiles show the same number, the "doubles" are subtracted from the 10 points. Rose-tiles are "jokers" and stand for any number a scoring player wants.
The game ends, when all tiles are placed, or all coloured tiles are surrounded.

97494.description:
Nordwind 1945 is a wargame that simulates Operation North Wind (Unternehmen Nordwind) which was the last major German offensive of the Second World War on the Western Front.

Scale:
- The map covers a part from Alsace between Rhine River (east), Germany (north) Strasbourg (south) and Lorraine (west)
- One game turn for two days
- One hex. for 5 km
- Units are battalions, regiment of tactical groups (Allied Combat Command or German Kampfgruppen)

Game content:
- One 42x29,7 cm map
- 100 die-cut counters
- one rules booklet (in French), English version (pdf) available on Vae Victis Web site

97498.name: Operation C: Tödliche Kämpfe in einer vergessenen Zeit
97498.description:
Operation C is an german Dungeon crawler Prototyp!

Description:
4 heroes, a secret research station, forbidden experiments and a day where everything goes wrong. Take control over an arsenal of 25 weapons. Play 30 exciting missions. Did I say that in the research station dinosaurs were bred as bioweapons? This will be a hell of a day. Welcome to the CHIMAERE.

Operation C is an adventure board game for 4 players. The players represent 4 different heroes, which have to complete various missions in the CHIMAERA research station. Equipped with a multitude of abilities, equipment and weapons, the heroes have to face powerful bioweapons, created in the facility using dinosaur DNA. The goal of each mission is to find the Objective sector of the mission. Each Round the players explore the facility, consisting of multiple sectors (dinosaur cages, laboratories, open space...). The sectors have the form of floor tiles, which are arranged side by side in a specific and different layout for each mission. When the players discover the Objective sector, they need to perform a specific task in it.

Visit us Facebook:
https://m.facebook.com/operationctk
Website:
http://operation-c.wix.com/homepage

97499.name: The Acts of the Disciples
97499.description:
Players take on the role of Jesus’ Disciples, traveling with Jesus through Palestine and performing deeds consistent with His teachings. But the actions the players will take will not always be received favorably by the three factions that will determine the fate of Judea — the Jews, who alternate between loving and resenting Jesus; Rome, which is not interested in Jesus but simply wants to impose civility and order, and the Pharisees, who abhor Jesus and who, as their anger increases, are looking for a member of Jesus’ inner circle to betray Him…

Each turn, players receive 4 actions, which they may spend traveling to one of the cities in Palestine, drawing action cards, spending action cards to perform a Deed in a city, or requesting Jesus to perform a Deed. Deeds come in four categories (preach, heal, exorcise a demon, or show compassion), and the cost of performing a Deed increases with each Deed performed in that category. But players can call on Jesus to perform a Deed, which resets that category's cost track and awards players present in the area with Gospel tokens. Most of the Deeds also result in consequences on one or more of the political tracks, representing the crowds, the Pharisees, or Rome.

The game ends either when the Rome track reaches its end (indicating that Jesus and the Disciples have attracted too much attention and Rome decides to intervene), or when the player who was dealt the Judas card elects to end the game, and receives the payout indicated on the Pharisees track.

The players' score is comprised of victory points received from the Deeds they performed, the Gospel tokens they accumulated, and the conditions described on their secret Goal cards that they received at the start of the game.

97500.name: Trimino
97500.description:
Similar to Triominos but the numbers (pips) are on the sides of the triangular tiles rather than the corners.

45 tiles with a number from 1 to 4 on each side.

Game play is similar - play a tile on your turn but there are shape templates in the instruction booklet that have to be followed. Try to use all your tiles as points are deducted per pip left at the end

Instructions in English, but game is language independent.
